dialogues.speaker: TITLES SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: PHOTOGRAPHIC STILLS show us NICOLA TOSCANI as a city boy various growing-up SHOTS, circa 1950's -- with street chu wearing a Wyatt Earp T-shirt, in a communion suit. Then: in his first qi, a youngster studying the martial arts; h grows, we see news clippings of him winning trophies, his name on contest posters, SHOTS of him in action. Then: Japan. Nico now in his teens, studying with real masters, being dumped on his butt, posing smiling beside Japanese martial artists, then himself as an instructor. Now: a few military uniforms enter the picture, we see security clearance documents with Nico's picture and name on them. Then Nico near draft age with an American friend NELSON FOX on some kind of training base. TITLES END.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blowing through the roof of a dense jungle straight AT CAMERA, HELICOPTER ROTORS RISE to a DEAFENING PITCH. SUPER:  Viet - Cambodian Border, 1972. Jungle foliage whips in the fierce downdraft as --

dialogues.speaker: "HUEY" GUNSHIP
dialogues.text: with US Army markings becomes discernible. The chopper lowers toward a crude landing zone hacked out of the wilderness. We GLIMPSE Cambodian troops and several machine gun positions around the LZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watch from the edge of the landing zone. We recognize Nic and Fox, now in their twenties, dressed in the nonmilitar jungle attire that usually marks a CIA "spook."

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: touches down. THREE OLDER AMERICANS -- rough-looking, in their mid-thirties, all carrying some kind of medical bag -- disembark into the HOWLING ROTOR BLAST. They hit the ground nimbly, as if they've done it many times before.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER OF THREE
dialogues.text: wears a khaki cowboy hat and packs a pearl-handled .45.

dialogues.speaker: NICO AND FOX
dialogues.text: don't know whether to react with laughter or uneasiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever see chemical interrogation before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico's eyes stay on the approaching "cowboy," KURT ZAGON, for whom he plainly feels an instant animosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These assholes are agency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOWS the medical bag in the cowboy's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all C.I.A. But these guys are from a page that ain't on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico in the point,   leading Fox and the three CIT (Chemi Interrogation Team)   men down an unmarked, twisting trai We see from Nico's   gait that he is athletic, a born lea and totally at home   in the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: TRAIL
dialogues.text: snakes along a ridge line, high enough to give us a view let us know these guys are way out in the boonies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long till we're across the border?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been over for the past hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group continues along the ridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky glows from nearby bomb attacks.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: listening hard -- and even sniffing the air -- glances ba at Zagon, who stands impatiently, drawing on a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at, hotshot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates cigarette glow) Why don't you light a bonfire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irritably, Zagon ditches his smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drive the taxi, ace. As the party moves out, Fox flashes Nico a look as if to "Don't fuck with these guys."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pocket-fortified position. Armed Cambodian lookouts, several hooches, radio equipment. Nico leads the party in through the perimeter. Zagon eyes the layout like he's se 100 of them. Fox indicates a hooch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zagon)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in there. The three CIT men start for the hooch. Nico casts a conce glance around at the base camp troops, looking sloppy as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust these yo-yo's.

dialogues.speaker: BASE CAMP
dialogues.text: We see Nico moving like a shadow from one defensive posit to another, checking the perimeter. We can vaguely hear h ROUSTING the Cambodian lookouts, speaking in dialect.

dialogues.speaker: DEFENSIVE POSITION
dialogues.text: hears a SOUND, looks back toward the hooch.

dialogues.speaker: HOOCH
dialogues.text: Two Asian prisoners, stripped to the waist, babbling in- coherently, are dragged out the back by a pair of Cambodi guards and hustled off into the darkness. VOICES can be heard inside the hooch. A single lantern glowing inside gives the hut a creepy, frightening aspect.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NICO
dialogues.text: He's extremely uneasy about what's about to happen inside hooch.

dialogues.speaker: RICKETY CARD TABLE
dialogues.text: on which are spread a terrifying array of syringes, drug and surgical instruments. Zagon's hand picks up a hypoder squirt-tests it.

dialogues.speaker: TWO ASIAN PRISONERS
dialogues.text: are on their knees, shirtless, handcuffed with heavy nylo tape to a stake driven into the ground in the center of t hooch. One of the subordinate CIT men moves in, grabs the first prisoner by the shoulders. Zagon injects the first prisoner. Instantly the man begins shivering, convulsing. Zagon watches with professional satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the nice thing about modern technology. You don't have to wait for results. He moves close to the first prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to first prisoner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it, Charley? You got six tons of our shit -- The prisoner tries to speak, but he's in such torment all that comes out is a blood-curdling wail --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hears this horrifying cry.   He starts swiftly toward the hooch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has moved as close to Zagon and the first prisoner as a f referee to two boxers. The prisoner is convulsing wildly. Zagon grabs him fiercely by the hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you die on me, fucker --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the side)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throws the prisoner down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This pussy can't hold his liquor. The first prisoner is plainly in a death spasm.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: enters at this point. He takes in the scene quickly, move to a spot beside the entrance. Zagon doesn't look at Nico but it's plain he is aware of Nico's presence. It is as i he wants to prove something to this muscular kid -- and p it to the others, too. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                         5.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST PRISONER
dialogues.text: dies in agony on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PRISONER
dialogues.text: watches with eyes like flint. He is in his mid-forties, scarred, missing several fingers. Probably a colonel or higher, he looks like he's been fighting these round-eyes since the French in the 50's. He is plainly one tough customer. The second prisoner meets Zagon's eyes, as if daring him to use the drugs on him, too. Zagon eyes the prisoner with barely contained hatred. The prisoner doesn back down an inch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to second prisoner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So my little doctor bag doesn't                      * scare you, eh? Well I don't need                     * it to open your yap.                                 * Zagon reaches to a scabbard on his Western belt, pulls ou fearsome serrated blade -- a cross between a bowie knife a scalpel. He steps toward the prisoner, displaying the blade in the lantern light.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: watches impassively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to prisoner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's our load, you sack of slime? What did you do with my shit? --

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON
dialogues.text: punches  the prisoner full in the face, holding the knife handle  in his fist to double the force of the blow and t terrify  him with the proximity of the blade. The prisone crashes  sideways, face bloody --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna teach you good. I'm gonna teach you never to fuck with my opium --

dialogues.speaker: FOX AND TWO CIT MEN
dialogues.text: seem to know exactly what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: didn't know, but the new kid on the block is catching on Nico has difficulty containing his emotion. Zagon stands over the prisoner, as if daring him to get back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoner gets back to his knees, bloody eyes meeting Zagon's with defiance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to prisoner) You're a hard nigger, aren't you, boy? You took it from the Chinks... you took it from the French. You'll be fucked if some Yankee peckerwood's gonna start your gums flapping -- Nico watches Zagon move the knife blade closer to the prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Well, you're gonna chirp for me, tough guy. You're gonna sing like a choir -- Nico takes a step toward Zagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck does this have to do with military intelligence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your orders are 'assist and observe' cherry -- Zagon turns to face Nico --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nico) Back off, partner -- Zagon turns from Nico. He moves close to the second priso close as a lover, displaying the blade in the lamplight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to second prisoner) I'm gonna start carving at your ankles. We'll throw your feet in that box right over there. Then I'm gonna take off your arms -- One of the CIT men yanks the prisoner's leg forward, clam it to the ground with his hands. The prisoner still hasn' flinched. He seems as locked into this dance of death as Zagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't take much more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can disappear as easy as this slope, kid -- Zagon starts for the prisoner. Here comes the blade. Suddenly -- Nico grabs Zagon's shoulder. Zagon spins with terrifying quickness, cocking the blade to slash at Nico. Before Zagon's blow even starts, Nico slams him with a ferocious elbow shot right under the jaw. Zagon literally comes off the ground, Nico's blow is so terrific. Zagon d in an unconscious heap. In a flash the two other CIT men move to jump Nico. Smash! The second CIT man is swallowin his teeth. Fox leaps in the way of the third, shoves Nico out of the hooch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox wrestles Nico away from the hooch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?!! (as Nico jerks free)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck's the matter with you?!!! Nico is shaking with rage and fear. He takes several step away from the hooch, then draws up abruptly. Nico pulls h .45 from his holster, pops the safety, starts back for th hooch --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't cap him now, he's gonna do me later. The last CIT man appears, gun drawn, in the hooch doorway Fox grabs Nico, hauls him back again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll cover this. Get back to the

dialogues.speaker: L.Z. --
dialogues.text: (as Nico resists)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'll fix it! Get out! Get the fuck outa here! The CIT man calls out to the Cambodian troops, in dialect pointing at Nico. The soldiers start toward Nico, as if t seize him. Fox, too, starts yelling to the troops in dial apparently countermanding the orders of the CIT men. The troops, confused, hold up for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nico)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call for a chopper... get outa here! ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                        8. Nico gives a last look, turns and takes off down the jung trail. Fox seems abandoned. The DISTANT BOMBING CONTINUES Nico disappears into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH STEEPLE
dialogues.text: TILT DOWN to reveal St. Elizabeth's, a huge parish church an Italian/Latino neighborhood in Chicago. The church loo festive, we see a few formally-dressed people hurrying in then a squad car pulls up. The cops run upstairs as if they're late --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baptism in progress. Nico -- 15 years older than when w last saw him, is standing beside SARA, his lovely wife -- watching a 60-ish priest, FATHER GENARRO, finish the final ritual on Nico's infant son Julian. The priest straightens the baby's baptismal garment, tugging the clo around the little fellow's crotch. Smiles from friends an relatives clustered proudly around. Several cops, some in uniform are amongst them. Nico grabs his son from Genarro with a theatrical protective motion, tugs up the little b garment, kisses him smack on the bare butt. Laughter from all as Nico holds the lad high and proud. He puts his arm around Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge trays of Italian delicacies are carried out into the sunlight by several "old country"-type women. Wine is poured from generous carafes. Friends and relatives are everywhere, laughing and enjoying themselves; apparently the party has come here straight from the church. Present for the new baby are being opened by Nico's wife, Sara, and Nico's mother, ROSA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, look at this -- all done by hand. Sara lifts a cute baby outfit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico had one just like this.   Thank you, Cora. Cora, an aunt, proudly smiles.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: Holding the baby. Realizes that his little son has pooped in his pants. He turns for help to Sara. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we got a little problem here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winking at the women) I carried him for the last nine months, you take him for the next diaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assorted uncles and aunts watch with amusement as Nico tr awkwardly to deal with the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all) That's what you get for not marrying a Sicilian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara lets Nico struggle a moment, then takes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brave husband. He's not afraid of thieves and muggers, but he's terrified when his son poops in his pants. Toscani relatives look on with approval at the happy coup and their baby.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF BACK YARD
dialogues.text: Three Chicago cops, LUKICH and HENDERSON in plain clothes and LIEUTENANT STROZAH in uniform wolf some Italian goodi while eying the group of celebrating relatives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates Nico across the patio) Toscani holds the record... for havin' more relatives under federal indictment than any other cop in Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: TWO OF NICO'S UNCLES
dialogues.text: BRANCA and LUIGI, who   look like they have been on the o side of a cop's work,   are in turn eying Lukich and Hend -- plus a cluster of   other cops in civvies hovering aro the buffet table like   vultures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these stiff dicks. A free meal and they come out like flies.

dialogues.speaker: STREET OUTSIDE NICO'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: An unmarked police car pulls up. DOLORES JACKSON ("Jax"), another undercover cop, tall, black, and elegant, enters the driveway leading to Nico's back yard -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         10.

dialogues.speaker: BACK YARD
dialogues.text: Jackson enters. She's impeccably dressed and radiates intelligence. She's greeted warmly by Lukich, Henderson, Strozah, and a couple of other cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do nothing, Counselor.    I'm clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight more days, Lieutenant. You better start preparing your defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby, I'm gonna put you on retainer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You passed the bar? I make it a point never to pass the bar. Jackson sees Nico and Sara across the yard, waves and starts toward them --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BRANCA AND LUIGI
dialogues.text: Luigi indicates Jackson as she crosses the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this cop.    She can bust me any day.

dialogues.speaker: NICK, SARA AND ROSA, (NICO'S MOTHER)
dialogues.text: Jackson comes up, makes a theatrical appreciation of Nico stylish attire, kisses Sara and greets Nico's mom warmly. She starts oohing and ahhing over the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young kids playing on the lawn, more guests arriving, Fat Genarro dancing with an elderly matron. We see that Nico' friends are an electric mix. Cops, art-y types, people of varied ages and professions.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JACKSON
dialogues.text: Holding the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this little bundle.    What a cupcake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give up being the D.A. and hurry up and find the right fella, Jax. You might have time for one of these yourself. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                        10A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico, will you let the woman catch her breath?

dialogues.speaker: JAPANESE WOMAN, (DR. WATANABE)
dialogues.text: moves in shyly on the fringe of the cluster. While Jackso and Sara continue their "mom" talk, Nico edges off toward Watanabe, shaking her hand with real pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watanabe!   Say hey, Doc. They begin jabbering in Japanese. We will meet Watanabe again later. She's a brainy-looking woman -- reserved, a bit mysterious -- who talks quietly intensely in Japanese with Nico like they're old friends go back a long way. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Branca, Luigi and several other Toscani patriarchs smoke cigars and sip beer in a cluster. Nico holds Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a father now. Are you gonna take me up on my offer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy, Branca.    I like what I do. Branca glances seriously to the other uncles, then, with smile, pats Nico's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this face! Six-foot-four, pretty as the statue of David. And he's a cop! Branca laughs. From a distance, Watanabe watches, missing nothing. Across the porch, Lukich and several other cops observe and try to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This face should be sticking up from a white shirt. It should be a banker, a businessman, someone who earns a decent living for his family!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nickels and dimes. Your wife's a woman with class. What did she run -- a ballet school...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An art gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing. She wants a husband who carries a briefcase, not a shoulder holster. Jackson watches Nico trying to keep his good humor. This is serious stuff, despite the light tone. Branca's eyes meet Nico's. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                        12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to get shot, you got shot. You wanted to get knifed, you got knifed. You've had your fun. Basta! Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let your family help you, Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Gio, that kind of help I don't need. I'd rather get shot by someone I don't know. Jackson and Lukich crack up. The others follow.   For the moment, the tension is dispelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico comes out of the bedroom, adjusting his shoulder holster, tugging his jacket over it. He sees his mother standing near the head of the stairs, just outside another bedroom door. Concern on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in here, Mama? Go join the party... Nico comes down the hall, tucking in his shirt -- stops to give his mother a squeeze. O.S. from the bedroom: the sound of QUIET SOBBING. Nico glances in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara and another woman sit on the bed, comforting a 60-is grandmother Zingaro, who is crying. Nico comes in. He kneels before MRS. ZINGARO, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Z. (tries to be light)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a way to act on the day of my son's baptism? The poor woman can't meet Nico's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Lucy.   She's gone again. Nico glances from Sara to Rosa. Mrs. Zingaro shakes her head, choked with pain. Nico holds her, looking over her shoulder toward Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that kid from the bar on Damen? The one with the drugs? ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          13. Sara doesn't know. Nico does.     He comforts Mrs. Zingar another moment, then stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Mrs. Z. Are you listening? (as the woman nods miserably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to work now. But I'll come by tonight. You'll be at the bakery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si, Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll talk, okay? We'll find a way to take care of this. Nico kisses Mrs. Z. He takes Sara's hand in goodbye, starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Festivities still in progress. Nico passes through, nodding, thanking people for coming, taking farewells. Jackson waits for him, glancing at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico is driving.   Jackson checks in on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unit Ten Tango X-ray.    We're up and clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves into the central city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad-looking hombres on stoops, street corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised the Lieutenant, I'm gonna take care of you. Broken windows and lost kittens for your last week. WIDEN SHOT to include Nico and Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then you're gonna come visit me in a nice, clean, air conditioned office -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unmarked car pulls up outside a liquor store and bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it parks. Jackson gives Nico a look:     "What are we stopping at this dive for"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta take a quick leak. Stay put. He gets out of the car, starts for the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim, smoke-choked, dangerous characters at the bar.    Ni enters. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                            1 His silk shirt and sport coat clash with the druggy, work class attire of the bar's denizens. Hard faces check him subtly, ignore him. Nico approaches the bartender, shows photograph. The bartender (BAD DUDE) shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck don't you assholes                        * leave me alone?                                        * He continues mouthing off to Nico. Nico moves to one stoo then another; the same exchange is repeated.

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR ONE PARTICULARLY TOUGH CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: A hulking bruiser with an earring.   He watches as --

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: approaches him. Three ARMY JACKETS look up sullenly. Beefy arms, tattoos, greasy mustaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. One Jacket treats him like he doesn't exist, and begins to pick his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was a kosher bar. They didn't allow no pork in here. The two others snicker, then so does the rest of the bar. Nico holds out a photo of a young girl (Lucy).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen this girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen the top of her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's witty. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        15A. Nico takes a step away, as if moving on to the next stool. From behind the bar, the bartender swings a sawed-off baseball bat into view. Other bodies move ominously toward Nico. Suddenly he spins and, in a move almost too quick to see, he kicks the entire stool right out of its floor socket. Beer bottles fly, bodies crash. Nico slams the First Jacket in the face so hard it looks like his nose has exploded. Blood sprays onto Nico's silk shirt. He hauls the Second Jacket upright, nails him with a shot that crushes three ribs. A savage elbow blasts the third, head over heels, out over the bar and careening into the sink. In three seconds 600 pounds of fat has been put in cold storage. The rest of the bar is on its feet. Four huge men confront Nico. Now five. Six. Seven. Nico's jacket and shirt are ripped, blood spat- tered; his eyes are like an animal's, daring the men --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   Show me something. No one moves. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                           16

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it.   It's a gay bar.   Is that it? The men, led by the Bad Dude, are shifting to surround Nico. But no one attacks. Nico has Lucy's photo in his hand. He jams it in one man's face, then another's, slap- ping each one violently, spitting, raging for them to att

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen the top of her head, huh? Like I seen your mother's -- (to another guy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or was it yours? (to a third)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or yours? (slaps him fero- ciously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't tell, it looked like her ass -- Nico rages like a beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, motherfuckers.    Do it. Do it! One man -- Nico lunges for the Bad Dude, grabs him like he's about to tear his face off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs! (in terror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's upstairs! 4-D! Nico drags the Dude from behind the bar.     Holding him, Nico turns, glowering, to all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cocksuckers are brave enough with 14-year-old girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico throws Bad Dude down the hallway in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts in from a jackhammer kick. Nico stands in the hallway. Bad Dude stands next to him; hurt, shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bad Dude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here. We look in the apartment. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                         16A.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: A young PIMP -- quite  handsome in a boyish way -- stares in panic from a grimy  mattress on the floor. Little LUCY is in bra and panties,  strung out, 14 and beautiful. Syringes and free-base  paraphernalia are on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pimp) This ain't your day, kid. Nico comes in, eyes taking in everything. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, man.   It ain't like it looks -- Nico grabs the Pimp by the scruff of the neck, lifting hi bodily. Lucy starts wailing in horror. Nico smashes the Pimp's face down into a mirror with white powder on the table --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's two years. He jerks the Pimp back, rips open a drawer.    More pills and glacene bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's four. (twisting the   Pimp's neck toward   Lucy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll get you eight   more. And I'm just warming up   -- Lucy is crying hysterically. Nico flings the Pimp, face bloody, toward the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nico, indicat- ing drugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it, baby. It's all yours --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your clothes on, Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's money. Three grand in the mattress... (begging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I can get ya more --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three young STUDS have ambled to the window of her parked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sister, what it be? With infinite boredom, Jackson lifts her badge -- and gun. The Studs shuffle away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other tenants stare from doorways as Nico drags the Pimp to the top of the flight of stairs, threatening to throw him down. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        17A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you fuckin' move.                           * Nico steps back into the apartment, hauls out Lucy in a dressing gown. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        18.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF LANDING
dialogues.text: The Pimp is dazed, bloody. Nico comes down with Lucy, hauls the Pimp to his feet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him alone! He's beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not when I get through with him. Nico lifts the Pimp by the throat, pins him to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man, wait! I'll give you something! Something big!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Nico!    Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's huge! I swear it! A shipment... coming in next Tuesday --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shipment, my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is square! On my mother's soul! You can't send me up -- Nico glances to Lucy. Half of him wants to tear the Pimp apart, the other half doesn't want to make the poor girl's life any more tragic. Besides, he's a good cop -- and maybe this "shipment" is on the level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard it from a hooker friend of mine. She's banging some big coke lawyer, he told her. I swear to Jesus! Nico relents -- a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. (sees Nico doesn't believe him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That platinum chola... Carla DeCarlo... she knows. Nico tightens his grip on the Pimp's throat. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got popped this afternoon. She's downtown. Red dress, lizard shoes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson looks up from the car to see Nico -- wild-haired, shirt ripped and bloody -- emerging from the adjacent apartment stoop, leading young Lucy, who's tear-streaked, wearing a torn dressing gown. Instantly, Jackson is out of the car, moving to Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, girl. Mama Jax is here. She wraps an arm around Lucy, helps her toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nico)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was some leak you took. From the door of the bar, several bloodied heads peek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broken windows and lost pussy cats, huh. Jackson checks out her battered partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one crazy bastard, Toscani. Nico opens the rear door, helps Jackson ease Lucy in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get her some clothes and a bath. I'm not bringing her home to her grandmother like this.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 62

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the front seat of Nico's car emerges a tearful Lucy, in fresh clothes and looking miserably contrite. Nico walks her inside. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                         20. The Zingaro family is busy preparing for the night's baki Grandpa and Grandma Zingaro leave their work and receive their waif-like granddaughter. With eyes watering they thank Nico. They disappear upstairs with Lucy. Jackson, standing in the doorway, has seen all this.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Nico at the wheel has just pulled away from the bakery. Jackson, in the passenger seat, studies her partner for a few moments, shaking her head at the contradictions in th man. Educated, classy, an elegant dresser -- yet undernea an out-and-out wild man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get you, Toscani. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing being a shitheel cop? With your background? For a long moment Nico says nothing.   Then, quietly, loo ing straight ahead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was overseas, I saw some things. Things that eat your guts out. Things that stay in front of your eyes like they were burned in and branded. He turns to Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can walk away from them, Jax. You can quit, but you know it's still going on. You try something anyway -- (smiles a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I know I'm not going to change the world. I can't stop the tonnage coming in, I can't fight the boys behind the desks pushing their buttons --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But maybe here, huh? (indicates street)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe in my own city, my own neighborhood, on my own block -- maybe here I can do something. He turns a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm a shitheel cop. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                         20A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the desk, a few detectives man the phones.   A Lat attorney, ABANDANO, is at the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see your client. As soon as she's through eating her dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hookers, female addicts, etc. in the downtown "cage." Nico has the girl in the red dress and lizard shoes (CARLA DECARLO) out in the hallway adjacent to the lock- up. Nico is Mr. Charm, offering her a heart-shaped box of chocolates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla... Carla -- I just want the name of your boyfriend --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got 200 boyfriends. The hooker, Carla DeCarlo, slaps the box away, cursing in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinchi cabron, cabeza colon! Some of the chocolates tumble onto the lockup floor, the detainees snap them up, start munching. The girl con- tinues to spit curses at Nico, gesturing with her hands with Latin flamboyance. Nico grabs her by the elbow, as a jailer opens the lockup door. More curses are being flung at Nico from various females in the cage. Nico heaves Carla in among them. Carla flops down on a bench next to a tall black hooker. MOVE IN ON the black hooker. It's Nico's partner, Jackson, dolled up like a street- walker, playing her undercover role to the hilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nico)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you sons-a-bitches ever treat someone with a little respect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't your goddamn sister.   We ain't got the same mother, motherfucka. Carla fires one final parting salvo of obscenities, then sags back among the women. Carla starts to cry. Jackson comforts her; Carla responds, lets herself be comforted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson, back in her normal daytime wear, exits a building. She gets into Nico's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson checks her makeup in the rearview mirror. Nico sits behind the wheel. The two are on some kind of stakeout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lawyer's name is Abandano. He's on the third floor. I got a look at him. I couldn't get how he's connected, but according to Carla, he's a lousy lay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can bust him for that. Jackson spots something, gestures subtly out window -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                           22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short, slick-looking Latin man in a business suit emerg from the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our stud. Nico and Jackson leave their car and follow him on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABANDANO meets a striking-looking middle-aged woman in fr of a stately financial institution. They go in. Jackson remains out on the street, while Nico follows the couple

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Jackson has been waiting, sipping some coffee. Nico emerges from the bank, signaling to his partner to follow him. Abandano and the woman exit from the bank's revol- ving doors and immediately jump into a cab. Nico and Jackson look at each other and step in front of another cab. Nico opens the cab door, flips his badge open, then asks the occupant to leave. Jackson gets in the front seat next to the protesting cabbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abandano and the woman are crossing the plaza as Nico and Jackson run up the block. Near the entrance to the Federa Building, a small but vocal group of protestors are gathered, carrying signs and chanting slogans. The frus- trated cabbie watches them in the background.

dialogues.speaker: PLAZA
dialogues.text: Jackson and Nico watch Abandano and the woman pass the crowd of demonstrators and enter the building. Jackson ac indifferent, almost frustrated; Nico keenly senses someth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main dining room. No customers, just busboys readying tables for the evening's business. We notice one of the busboys is the "pimp" Nico found with Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTH NEAR BACK HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The owner's table. Stacks of dining checks, a cashbox and calculator, full ashtrays, wine glasses. BAUTISTA SALVANO, a heavyset, swarthy Venezuelan dressed in a tux with the collar open, glowers across the table at a mus- cular, scar-faced Latin busboy -- the kind who looks like he does more for his boss than clean up the tables. The busboy (NARDO) is nervous, apologetic -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I brought you in for your muscles, Nardo, not your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your English is getting good... You're showing it off. Showing it off on the street --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep quiet.    I never talk no more -- Salvano glowers at Nardo like he's about to punch him. Instead he reaches over, playfully chokes the busboy -- then releases him, as if all is forgiven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make yourself useful. (indicates empty wine bottle on table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get downstairs, bring me one of these. (as Nardo stands, starts for back hallway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nardo enters at the top of the stairs, radiating relief. He trots down into the empty basement, toward a floor-to- ceiling wine rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was dead, man. (whistles with relief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was fucking dead. He crosses to the wine rack. It's dark, hard to see. He searches for the bottle. Suddenly: a METALLIC sound behind him. Nardo turns -- CHI CHI TESTAMENTE, a wiry, pock-faced Latino, stands in the shadows (it is clear he has been waiting there, hiding) -- holding a small silencer automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right, cabron.                            * ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                           24 One SHOT between the eyes and Nardo CRASHES backward into the WINE RACK, eyes wide with shock and bewilderment. Chi Chi SHOOTS him AGAIN; Nardo drops like a stone. Coolly, professionally, Chi Chi pumps FOUR more SHOTS into the prone busboy's head. Chi Chi ejects the clip into his palm, unscrews the silencer, holsters the gun. Salvano appears at the top of the stairs. Two busboys are behind him. One of them is the young pimp. The busboys hurry down, the pimp -- scared shitless but playing it macho-co Salvano comes down the stairs. Chi Chi stands over his wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to busboys)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean up this mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows who else is talking --                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a young fool.                                   *

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN UPSTAIRS DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Salvano and Chi Chi emerge from the basement steps and walk toward their booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're crazy waiting for this bullshit 'shipment.' Let me waste the other fucker now. Salvano puts a hand on Chi Chi's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be patient. This will be done the way it was planned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusting cyclone fences surround   a mud-lot repair yard i dingy industrial section. Young    Lation and black worke finish up for the night; through   the dirty, security-ba office window we can see Chi Chi   talking on the phone. lawyer, Abandano, is also there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico finishes connecting a small transmitter which has been hastily wired to the entering phone line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Jackson in the shadows down the street from the body shop. Nico wears earphones, a small tape recorder on the seat beside him. Jackson does not look happy. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toscani, you're going to have me doing time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighten up, Jax. No one's bringing this into court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except against us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit how we do it. I just wanna get there. Jackson gives Nico a dirty look, but stifles her protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said you were gonna protect me. Cover my butt. Be my guardian angel -- Nico hears something through the earphones.    Gestures f silence --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chi Chi listens with increased intensity to something on phone. He starts writing it down --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NICO
dialogues.text: In unmarked car.   He's writing it down too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the shipment.                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    What's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scribbling furiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... Engine block has cleared customs. Serial number VA-748. Pick up Tuesday, 3 May as authorized.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chi Chi emerges from the office, tucking a scrap of paper into his pocket. Abandano follows. They get into a late-model Lincoln which pulls out onto the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Jackson's car follows at a discreet distance. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                           26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unit Ten Tango X-ray. I need a vehicle registration I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '86 Lincoln.    Illinois 354 Dog '67.                *

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jackson picks up Nico's pad to take down the response. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vehicle registration follows. Leaseholder: Ramon Testamente, registered alien. Nation of origin: Venezuela. Do you wish criminal record search?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know when he wipes his                     * behind.                                              *

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: As Nico and Jackson tail the Lincoln out of the industria zone into a fancier, non-Latin neighborhood. On the sidew we glimpse theatergoers, fashionable white couples out on town.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: Pulls up to a valet park outside a ton-y restaurant.    A sign says: "BOGOTA."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Jackson exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackpot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chi Chi and Abandano get out of their car, a valet takes Chi Chi enters the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Jackson enter the main dining room, which we recognize from the scene with Nardo the busboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is packed with fashionable people of all races. A band plays salsa; couples dance. Nico and Jackson pass easily as a hip "uptown" couple. A pretty Latin HOSTESS approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two for drinks. They elbow up to the packed bar, standing.   Nico squints toward the rear dining room.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN BAR
dialogues.text: Looking past numerous patrons, we see Chi Chi whisper something to a waiter and take a seat at a rear table (the same "owner's table" where Salvano sat before.) The waiter hurries off into a back hallway.

dialogues.speaker: NICO AND JACKSON
dialogues.text: Jackson moves to the salsa beat.   A BARMAID approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme something stiff.   I need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who doesn't? Nico's eyes never leave Chi Chi.

dialogues.speaker: REAR DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: From the back hallway Salvano emerges -- in his tux, looking prosperous. He sits down beside Chi Chi and Abandano. A waitress brings two drinks. After a few words, Chi Chi removes the scrap of paper from his pocket hands it to Salvano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have your engine block next Tuesday, boss.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NICO AND JACKSON
dialogues.text: As the Barmaid brings their drinks. Jackson sees her peaceful week to retirement flying out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why couldn't it be a week from Tuesday? I could read about it in the paper. Nico grabs her waist, pulls her onto the dance floor, and does a playful twirl. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                           28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheer up, partner.   I'm gonna make you famous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Track spurs, greasy streets, parked fork lifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Strozah surveys the street traffic.

dialogues.speaker: NICO, JACKSON AND LUKICH
dialogues.text: The two men, dressed as meat processors in hard hats and bloody white coats, rake cattle guts under the eave of a packing plant. Jackson, dressed like a USDA Inspector and carrying a clipboard, inspects a few hanging carcasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed a few spots, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm takin' it home t'a make kilbasa, boss. Luke casts an impatient glance across the street to a lot with four parked meat trucks. We glimpse two "truckers" keeping low in the shadows of one cab. Down the block a seemingly empty pickup truck is parked in an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't a bust -- it's a convention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you like company, Luke? (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got all the scouts here -- Drug Enforcement Agency, the Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep this channel clear, Toscani. We realize Nico, Jackson and Lukich are wired, with mikes out of sight under their coats. Nico glances to the pick- up, near to which three men can be spotted in the alley. Apparently one of them is the walkie-talkie voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our channel, dickhead. And our collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough, all of you! Keep this channel clear. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87   28A.

dialogues.speaker: MEAT PLANT
dialogues.text: Nothing happening. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead as hell.

dialogues.speaker: NICO, LUKICH AND JACKSON
dialogues.text: Bored, pissed off, tired.   Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: BATTERED VAN WITH TWO MEN
dialogues.text: emerges from a corner, two blocks down.    It starts slow this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Everyone get their heads outa their ass. The meat truck men duck down out of sight, the pickup men back into the shadows. Nico and Lukich keep raking cow guts. The van passes slowly, checking out the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... And so I quit the police department... got myself a steady job -- ' The van accelerates slightly, turns a corner, vanishes. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They spotted me. I'm too good- looking to be a meat slopper.                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you hot dogs shut up? The van returns.   On a cross street.   Heading behind th packing plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lukich)                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too ugly. Now a second car appears. The Lincoln. Behind it is an ancient station wagon. Both vehicles take a different cross street, but both heading behind the packing plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into hidden mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go, boys and girls -- (to Jackson)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay put.                                       * As soon as the two vehicles pass out of sight, Nico and Lukich ditch their rakes, dart into the packing plant. The meat truck men START their TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pickup men board their vehicle -- Jackson follows Nic and Luke -- but at a safe distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Lukich sprint in a crouch past the blood runoffs meat cutting tables --

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING
dialogues.text: THROUGH the windows at the rear of the plant, we see the station wagon and the van, pulling up swiftly beside one another, men getting out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Lukich draw their guns, running full-tilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into hidden miki) It's going down now. Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon men heave their rear door open, the van men start to open their side door. The Lincoln is stopped at a distance. Suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: NICO AND LUKICH
dialogues.text: burst from the rear door of the packing plant, guns drawn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police!

dialogues.speaker: VAN AND STATION WAGON MEN
dialogues.text: grab for their weapons --

dialogues.speaker: COPS IN MEAT TRUCK AND PICKUP
dialogues.text: come highballing around both sides of the packing plant -

dialogues.speaker: VAN AND STATION WAGON MEN
dialogues.text: OPEN FIRE. There is confusion and mayhem; it's not clear who's a cop and who's a criminal.

dialogues.speaker: NICO AND LUKICH
dialogues.text: dive for cover, RETURNING FIRE. The DEA men in one truck also OPEN UP. One of the van men is hit between the eyes. MACHINE GUN FIRE rakes the DEA truck; it spins out of control; flips. Lukich SHOOTS the machine-gunner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts; points) Nico!   The Lincoln!

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: starts to PEEL OUT. We glimpse Chi Chi in the driver's seat, Salvano on the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: steps in front of the accelerating Lincoln, raises his .4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvano and Chi Chi dive below the dash and continue forward. Salvano, in the passenger seat, raises his GUN; FIRES blindly -- trying to hit Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico UNLOADS his .45 into the windshield and the firewall The Lincoln keeps coming down the narrow alley.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: brazenly steps up onto the hood and dives, grabbing onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvano can't believe it. He screams something in Spanish. He FIRES again, this time through the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullet holes appear.    Nico narrowly misses being hit.

dialogues.speaker: LINCOLN
dialogues.text: Nico reaches over the side of the car and SMASHES the pas senger WINDOW with his fist.

dialogues.speaker: NICO'S HAND
dialogues.text: Salvano's face is bashed.     Nico's huge hand grabs Salv throat; he won't let go.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: He hangs on with one hand.

dialogues.speaker: SALVANO
dialogues.text: Nico's fingers now    dig into Salvano's larynx; he may n talk again. He's     gagging. Salvano now points the gun Chi Chi. Chi Chi     makes the decision to stop the car i order to save his    boss. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                            3

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: leaps off the roof pulling Salvano past the broken glass, out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: SEVERAL POLICE VEHICLES
dialogues.text: SCREECH into the lot. Officers pour out, guns drawn, surrounding the Lincoln and the other vehicles. Jackson joins them, weapon in hand.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: drags Salvano by the neck across the lot to the van, slamming the drug dealer up against the van's side. Lukich, Jackson and Strozah are there, with the DEA cops, all covering the other men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Salvano)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many kilos you got in there, Skivuzo? Salvano couldn't answer if he wanted to. The other cops look at Nico with awe. Lukich whips the van door open, yanks a tarp off the cargo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine block sits in a wooden shipping frame, wrapped with industrial plastic. Nico climbs into the van, rips the plastic sheeting off, grabs the wood slats of the shipping frame, tears them off. In the background, ambulances are arriving to care for the wounded cops and criminals.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE BLOCK
dialogues.text: From the cylinder heads emerges a full load, not of drugs but of plastique tubes labeled U.S. ARMY C-4 HIGH EXPLOSI

dialogues.speaker: LUKICH, JACKSON AND OTHER COPS
dialogues.text: react with surprise and shock.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: rips open one of tubes and smells it.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: Confused; frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda fuckin' high is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPENING ON SALVANO, in a chair, looking bruised and swoll and wearing an expression of fuming indignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'll tell you what this cop is. He's a fucking menace!

dialogues.speaker: TWO FBI AGENTS, (NEELEY AND HALLORAN)
dialogues.text: face Salvano, Chi Chi and the lawyer Abandano (apparently representing Salvano and Chi Chi). Neeley is on the phone Pictures of Reagan and Meese are prominent on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see what he did to me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your problem is being handled right now, Mr. Salv --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well, it shoulda been handled twelve hours ago. I don't know who's running this outfit, but somebody better get his goddamn wires straight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- yes, sir... yes, sir, I understand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That maniac should be wearing a number, not a badge. Salvano knows what the call is about. He straightens the tie beneath his bruised neck, assuming the attitude of a respectable citizen who has been unjustly wronged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- count on it, sir. Right. You'll have our full cooperation. Neeley hangs up. Glances dubiously to Halloran. Then turn grimly to Salvano, Chi Chi and the lawyer Abandano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're free to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hoods and their lawyer smugly walk past a cleaning woman. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         33A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPENING ON Agent Neeley's face. Composed, clean-cut, but intense, wearing a light-colored business suit. PAN TO Agent Halloran -- the same upright, clean-shaven bureau l The two men are seated to one side of LIEUTENANT FRED STR

dialogues.speaker: NICO, JACKSON, LUKICH AND DEA AND ATF MEN
dialogues.text: sit and stand in various postures in front of the Lieuten desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nico, DEA & AIF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- This is no reflection on the work you officers have done. I feel, and the whole department feels, extremely proud of your initiative and gallantry. That "spare me the horseshit" look on Nico's face. He's fuming. Strozah sees Nico's bitter expression. It's on the others' faces too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As all of you   are well aware, possession of   these explosives is a federal   offense and under jurisdiction   of the F.B.I. Nico's eyes meet Lieutenant Strozah's. There's respect between the two, but it's plainly under a helluva strain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. With all respect to our brothers in the Bureau -- (biting sarcasm; turns to Neeley)                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That's no answer. It's no answer to why one of the biggest dealers in the city is out on the street now, free as a bird! Agent Neeley stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it in your pants, Nico. These men have a job to do, just like us. Nico stifles his outrage. The other cops exchange glances -- upset and angry. Agent Neeley clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, I think these officers are entitled to a fuller explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           34

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've risked their lives. I understand one man is in the hospital. He speaks to the officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm about to say doesn't leave this room. Is that clear? Assent from everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Salvano has been working for some time in cooperation with certain federal agencies.

dialogues.speaker: NICO'S FACE
dialogues.text: Stunned and furious at this royal fuck-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not at liberty to divulge the nature of Mr. Salvano's involvement -- I just learned of its existence myself a few hours ago. But one thing I can tell you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Salvano's role is crucial to an extremely sensitive ongoing investigation. Any further surveillance, harassment, or unauthorized operations against this individual are forbidden. I must order you gentlemen -- (looking straight at Nico)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- with all respect for your work and your courage, to stand down. Lukich shakes his head; Nico is devastated.     Jackson t it all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPENING CLOSE ON a desk drawer being opened. Aside from rounds of ammo, notes and an aging eggplant parmigiana sandwich, there are half a dozen hand-labeled audio- cassettes and a small collection of miniaturized bugging devices. Jackson and Lukich watch Nico take out the notes, hand them to Lieutenant Strozah. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tapes too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking) That's my Lawrence Welk collection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want everything you got on this one. Reluctantly, Nico hands over the tapes.   The Lieutenant the bugs and wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't give a shit about yourself, Toscani. (a glance to Jax) But you're gonna put Jackson's ass in a sling, too, with these illegal wires. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                         35A.

dialogues.speaker: 136A OTHER SIDE OF SQUAD ROOM
dialogues.text: Agent Halloran edges up to Jackson, who's grabbing coffee on the far side of the squad room, and watching from ther as Nico gives Strozah more of a hard time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the story on your partner, Jackson? Did he learn this style or was he born with a brick up his ass? Jackson checks Halloran out. He's black too and, despite herself, there's a certain rapport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has ethics. Unlike certain others on this case. Halloran watches the illegal bugs and tapes come out of Nico's drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His 'ethics' are gonna cost him his badge and his gun. This "white" talk gives Jackson a pain.   She slips into her jive mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't wanna catch him without no gun. Halloran's look asks why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause what he do with his hands... make bullet holes look pretty. Across the room, Nico turns over the tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad bad. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Jackson come down the stairs. Jackson has had ample excitement for her last week on the force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that enough? Can we do something normal now -- like eat lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you say, Jax.   How about Salvano's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it be, Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Jackson's car pulls out into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson and Nico are eating some fast good.   Nico reache to his jacket pocket; takes out a cassette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... you kept his tape, too? Nico already has it in the PLAYER. We hear FRAGMENTS of the telephone tap from the body shop in Spanish and English. Jackson looks frustrated. Nico listens care- fully to what appears to be the taped PHONE CONVERSATION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poetry, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pimp (busboy) comes out and dumps a load of garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Jackson case the restaurant from down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: From the restaurant door, Salvano and Chi Chi emerge. They get into a black Cadillac and pull out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now for some dessert.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: As Nico's car tails Salvano's through various streets. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvano comes out of a fancy flower shop with a bimbo on his arm. He kisses her goodbye and puts her in a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that must be Mrs. Sal. So nice to see married couples still in love.

dialogues.speaker: 144A NICO AND JACKSON
dialogues.text: are hidden, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: 144B CHI CHI
dialogues.text: emerges from a dry cleaner's with a suit on a hanger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvano's Caddy   pulls up outside the same church where saw Nico's son   get baptized. Salvano and Chi Chi get ou look both ways   up and down the street. Salvano, holding flowers, makes   eye contact with a car down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico's car backs out of sight around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: SIDEWALK IN FRONT OF CHURCH
dialogues.text: Salvano and Chi Chi, seeing nothing, enter the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smattering of older women and men praying. Salvano and Chi Chi stop at the head of the aisle, genuflect to the altar, move in, take seats toward the front.

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF CHURCH
dialogues.text: Nico and Jackson slip in the front door, glide silently into the shadows at the rear of the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your mother's church, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I bet she's never seen these boys in the choir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvano's head is bowed, but Chi Chi is looking around quite carefully. Nico and Jackson fade into the shadows behind the huge pillars. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                        37A.

dialogues.speaker: SALVANO AND CHI CHI
dialogues.text: After a few moments, the pair rises. They cross them- selves, start out for the front door. As they walk, they continue to look for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Jackson emerge into a courtyard which reveals a day care center and a rectory. They head toward the front of the building. Jackson, planning on picking up their tail on Salvano, is stoped by Nico. He wants to stay and look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicola! That can't be you in church without the family! Nico turns to see Father Genarro, perspiring in a baggy sweatshirt, a handball glove on his hand. The courtyard alongside the church is marked off as an athletic area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Genarro. The priest seizes Nico's hand warmly, smiles at Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be your partner in crime. (shakes her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Father Genarro. I saw you at the baptismal party. (with a wink to Nico)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolores Jackson (smiling, but impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico, we gotta go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please -- (more serious now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good you stopped by. I have to show you something. Please. The priest begins leading Nico and Jackson. Jackson keeps glancing back out the alley to see Salvano's car slowly driving by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an old building. The dark corridors resemble an underground bunker. Old trophies and furniture are stored along the walls. The two cops and the priest walk. Another priest emerges from a door, nods, passes. Nico and Jackson glance in through the door as they walk. They reach a door with a broken handle. It looks like a break-in has taken place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rats are getting bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two nights ago. I didn't call the police. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        39. Father Genarro knocks on the door, pauses, then knocks again. The door opens. A twelve-year-old who looks like he's from Central America stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, son. These are friends. The boy steps back and we MOVE INTO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A largish room, no exposed windows, everything boarded up Newly-constructed makeshift toilet and shower in one corn various cots. A number of LATIN REFUGEES -- families most -- react shyly as Father Genarro introduces Nico and Jack Sister Bonifacia is there, and a youthful priest, FATHER TOMASSINO. We will see both of them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (referring to the cops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are friends. (to Nico)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Father Tomassino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do? Nico shakes the young priest's hand. There is a moment between them as Nico meets Tomassino's eyes, liking what he sees. The refugees are relieved, however, when Father Genarro, Nico and Jackson take their leave.

dialogues.speaker: NICO, JACKSON AND FATHER GENARRO
dialogues.text: continue down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know this church was a sanctuary, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. But, perhaps not such a safe one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have they been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too long. At least the kids can go to our school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did it, Father? ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                 39A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids, maybe. (significantly) Maybe worse. It's not the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can have a car check by, every hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... please.    Police frighten these people. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three are outside, taking their leave. A big smile and a hand on Father Genarro's shoulder. The priest is greatly relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, I don't mind coming by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Nico... When was your last confession?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a married man, Father.   I've got no sins to confess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a police officer, you have many sins to confess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. Nico and Jackson start off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after Nico)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come back Sunday. I feel better when I see Nicola in church. (calls louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't show, I'm phoning your mother!

dialogues.speaker: SAME CHURCH
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE FROM ACROSS the street: neighborhood people dressed in their Sunday best fill the sidewalk, filing in for Mass. We hear an ORGAN from inside the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Italian neighborhood becoming more Hispanic. As the churchgoers file in, we see families -- women, kids, babies.

dialogues.speaker: NICO, SARA, ROSA AND JULIAN
dialogues.text: are among the crowd, exchanging pleasantries with friends and neighbors -- in English, Italian and Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, holding Julian, slips into a pew. As Nico and Rosa follow, Father Genarro passes, heading for the front. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Genarro! I have you to thank for getting my son back into church!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing what shame can accomplish. Father Genarro smiles and continues on toward the pulpit.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: building to the finish of a hymn.

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: also singing, balancing baby Julian and a hymnbook.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: sing with full gusto.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: makes the sign to be seated.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: sits. We notice a   young, intellectual-looking man (Alan Singletary)  wearing wire-rim glasses, sitting in the front row. We   will see his face again later. He looks out of place  and glances around, surprised as...

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: moves into the pulpit, opens his Bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In nomine patris, filius et spiritu sancti... (etc)

dialogues.speaker: SARA AND JULIAN
dialogues.text: The little one starts to CRY; she comforts him. Nico reaches over to try to help. The BABY continues FUSSING. Nico looks toward the priest and the front of the church. He notices a woman in a black shawl rise from the front of the church and turn, heading down one of the side aisles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examines Julian's diaper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Julian -- perfect timing. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           42 She cynically smiles at Nico. Nico sees the woman in black pass toward the exit of the church.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: It is the same woman Nico and Jackson were following with Abandano, the lawyer!

dialogues.speaker: LARGE SHOPPING BAG
dialogues.text: The woman has left it in front of the votive candles directly before the priest's pulpit.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: His head spins from the shopping bag to the doorway --

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY
dialogues.text: The woman is hastily sneaking out.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NICO
dialogues.text: Instantly he pushes his family to the floor, covering them with his body.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: BOOM!!!    A POWERFUL EXPLOSION erupts between the priest and his   congregation. Fragments of plaster, wood, and marble   come blasting past Nico and his family! Churchgo in the   first rows are blown off their feet by the shock wave of   the blast. Pews overturn, smoke everywhere --

dialogues.speaker: CHOIR
dialogues.text: is shrieking hysterically. Stone and plaster dust rain down on them from the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: CONGREGATION
dialogues.text: is in total pandemonium.   Screams, cries, panic --

dialogues.speaker: PULPIT
dialogues.text: has been blown to oblivion. Where Father Genarro had been standing is now nothing but smoke and rubble.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: Prone, covering Sara and the baby, groping frantically to protect his mother as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching baby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're okay! We're okay! Nico checks them and his mother swiftly. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help the others! Help them, Nico!

dialogues.speaker: STATUE OF JESUS
dialogues.text: Splattered with real blood.

dialogues.speaker: CONGREGATION
dialogues.text: Everyone is down, reeling from the concussion, dust and smoke. Nico rises alone from this scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help each other move outside.   Be calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a doorway and a shattered window smoke pours forth. We hear SCREAMS from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico on his feet, plainly the leader in this moment of terror. Worshippers, shattered and bleeding, pour past him toward the door. Nico grabs a stout-looking church- goer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call 911. Tell 'em to send everything they got! (turns to his wife)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, get the baby and Mama                        * outside. Nico starts for the altar where the damage is worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The congregation streams out in terror-stricken disarray. We see Nico's family -- they're all right.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: appears from the church, carrying a young choir girl. He hands the child over to two older women, races back into the church.

dialogues.speaker: STREET OUTSIDE CHURCH
dialogues.text: The first paramedic van comes speeding around the corner, SIREN BLARING. Police cars appear right behind -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                            4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico appears through the backlit smoke and kneels over the bloodied body of Father Genarro. He desperately tries to maintain the priest's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aftermath of the blast. Doctors and nurses have the scene more of less under control, but there's still plent of pain and misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico stands, his back to the wall -- a scary, blank look on his face. A doctor and several nurses are pulling the plugs on the terribly mutilated body of Father Genarro. A nun is crying; a fellow priest is blessing the Father.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: arrives.   Nico talks to her, aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a list of everyone that's been treated here today. Everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then find those sanctuary people, the ones we saw in the church basement -- As Jackson makes notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out where they're from, why anyone would want to harm them. Jackson flips her notepad shut, ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
