dialogues.text: Just stay near a radio.   I'll find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sits on a bench with a bandage over one eye. Sara and Julian are sleeping beside her. Nico kneels beside his mother, deeply concerned. Nico takes his mother's arm, helps her to her feet. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                        45. Sara wakes and picks up Julian. Mama knows Father Genarro has died. She begins sobbing softly. Other members of the congregation are in the hallway, mourning. Nico, with his family, takes several steps toward the exit. Suddenly Nico stops. He sees Agent Neeley entering (the FBI man wh ordered him off the case) accompanied by Lieutenant Stroz and two uniformed officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara... go down to the car; I'll                    * be with you in a minute. He hails Neeley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you. (a glance to Strozah and others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Alone. Neeley nods. Nico leads him off the corridor, through a fire exit door --

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL LANDING
dialogues.text: The door closes behind them. Nico and the FBI man are alone on the stairway landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is it, Toscani? Without warning, Nico grabs Neeley by both lapels, slams him furiously into the wall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.   That's what the hell it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your goddam hands off me! Neeley tries to shake free; Nico won't let him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let Salvano walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvano?! Are you crazy? (rips himself free)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he have to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was no cherry bomb in there. That was C-fucking-4! (struggles to master his rage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've used that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                        46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it smells like, I know what it blows like -- Neeley glares at Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvano never came near that C-4. It's in federal holding now! Besides, why would he blow up a church?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tailed Salvano. Two days ago. Him and one of his apes were in that church -- and they weren't taking communion. I saw some broad saw who was with his lawyer plant the bomb. Now I want some goddamn answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tailed him? After I ordered you off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?    Where's Salvano?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My orders were release him.    Not babysit him. Neeley brushes Nico's fingermarks off his lapels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're rough stuff, Toscani -- martial arts hero, chop suey crap. Well I'll tell you something: you're not bullet- proof. You're not even a good cop. (composes himself; reclaims his dignity) You sneak around, playing your street dick games. But all you come up with is conjecture, wild coincidence and bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the agent who signed for the explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do my job. You do yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank on it, pal. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                           47 Nico stalks off.   The door slams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico's unmarked car whips in front.   Nico storms toward the front door of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico storms through toward the restaurant rear. The employees are getting ready for the evening crowd. He flashes his badge, checks the kitchen, Salvano's office.   The man is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson has her list from the hospital.    A coroner and his assitant show her a body on a slab.    The body is that of Alan Singletary, the man we saw   in the front row of the church. Jackson takes notes.     The dead man is definitely not the ethnic type you'd   expect in St. Mary's congregation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same place where Nico and Jackson wire-tapped Chi Chi. Nico interrogates the shop boss, several workers. All shake their head, gesture emphatically. Salvano not here.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: takes Polaroids of the dead man's I.D. and personal effects.

dialogues.speaker: DEAD MAN'S EFFECTS
dialogues.text: as Jackson's flash pops. We see clearly a U.S. Senate staff ID, a U.S. Senate office building parking pass and an Illinois driver's license with address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico comes storming out. A Maid and a bodyguard follow after him screaming. The door slams. We see it is missing a panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be in real trouble, mister, when El Senor Salvano find out about dis. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                            4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson at the blast scene. Police tapes rope the area off while a TV news crew photographs the damage. Jackson talks with neighborhood people, asking questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico in the alley, grilling several tough guys we saw be- fore when he raided this bar. The answers are all zero; Nico's disgusted, worn out, frustrated. He starts out the alley -- At the edge of the street, a battered van pu in. A jacketed LATINO MAN leans against it, an unlit ciga rette in his mouth. As Nico approaches, turning toward his car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (polite, casual) 'Cuse me, sir. Can I bum a light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico slows, eyeing the   guy dubiously. As he reaches to his jacket -- The side   door of the van flashes open. A .38 is leveled straight   at Nico's head. Instantly three other Latino hoods leap   to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (machete under jacket) Don't even think about it, motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machete Man (First Latino) snatches Nico's gun from its shoulder holster. Two hoods shove Nico back into the alley. Nico checks out his assailants quickly. Four of them. Machete, CROWBAR, BALL BAT, GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come to our streets... fuck with our people. Now our people gonna fuck with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five advance on Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ain't gonna shoot you, man. We gonna beat you to death. You gonna learn what it means to 'get down.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A)   Nico is  trapped. The hoods advancing. Nico has a moment  of stillness, as if all senses are clicking out of  normal gear and into some hyper-combat readi- ness.   Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B)   Gun and Machete Man are side by side. As Machete Man starts to move, Nico spins in beside him, seizes his wrist, twists it violently, wrenching the machete away, keeping Machete Man between him and Gun Man so Gun Man can't shoot. In a flash, Nico swings the machete, slicing over the top of Machete Man, half-severing the wrist of Gun Man. Gun Man falls, clutching his wrist in agony; the gun skitters away beneath a chain link fence, out of reach. Nico flips Machete Man (who has Nico's gun in his pocket) sending him crash- ing, half-unconscious. C)   Instantly, Pipe Man aims a home run shot at Nico's head. Nico uses the machete, matches the angle of the oncoming blow, slides under and, in the same arc, blocks the blow and turns it into a strike, slashing Pipe Man's tendons behind the knee. Pipe Man goes down on one knee, writhing, hamstrung, crying out in pain. D)   Now Ball Bat attacks. Nico intercepts the blow, flips Bat Man ass over teakettle, sending him sail- ing -- feet first -- through the side window of the van. Bat Man CRASHES THROUGH the GLASS, hung up with just his head and shoulders dangling free. E)   Nico is spread out, feet wide, in a crouch. Crowbar Man sees his chance. He is the fiercest of the four, and the savviest fighter. He throws three consecu- tive vicious blows at Nico's head; Nico drops to one knee, dodges the blows, then intercepts the third, machete in hand, matches the arc of interception and whips the blade up -- straight into the crotch of Crowbar Man. Crowbar Man can't believe it. He re- mains frozen a moment, staring at Nico, then down at his own groin. F)   Machete Man, the first to be flipped, struggles des- perately to regain his senses. He tries to get Nico's gun from his own pocket, but Nico bats it a- way. Machete Man scrambles to his feet, in terror, bolts. G)   Nico snatches his gun from the sidewalk, glances to Bat Man who is still half-dangling from the van window. Nico gives Bat Man one parting punch to the head, then tears off after Machete Man --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrieks from passersby as Machete Man hurtles past, straight into the street. A car nearly hits him, he vaults its hood. Here comes Nico, in hot pursuit. He too leaps the car, whose owner is staring, cursing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An all-out foot face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machete Man is a speedster; he hurdles a row of trash can TWO YOUNG GIRLS, on a stoop, whistle as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fly, baby!

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: tears after this human cannonball.   Amazingly, he's gaining --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machete Man highballs off the sidewalk, straight into a Mom and Pop groceria. Customers scatter in shock as the hood blasts past them, out the back door. Here comes Nico. Patrons curse in Spanish as he barrels past --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machete Man bolts from the bodega into a small patio with tables and chairs. He leaps the fence into the next yard, which belongs to a funeral home. He hurdles the headstone inventory, clambers up the fence on the far side --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NICCO
dialogues.text: pursuing along the same route.

dialogues.speaker: MACHETE MAN
dialogues.text: claws his way to the top of the fence and onto a frame- work of two-by-fours which form an arbor-like canopy a- bove the third back yard. Plastic sheeting is tacked between the beams. Machete Man glances back at Nico, starts out -- tightrope-style -- across the two-by-fours. Nico reaches the fence behind the hood, starts also onto the two-by-fours. We hear FEMALE SCREAMS from below as the rickety structure starts to wobble precariously. Machete Man reaches the far side. A fire escape is ad- jacent; he grabs for it, starts up. Nico catches him by the ankle. The two crash together back onto the two-by- fours, which give way, sending them plunging into --

dialogues.speaker: BACKYARD OF FLOWER SHOP
dialogues.text: Four young Oriental women, potting plants, react with terror as the two bodies CRASH through. Machete Man scrambles away from Nico but is trapped in the corner next to the rear shop door. The flower girls can't move either; Nico and the hood are too near the door. The girls retreat to the far corner, squealing in fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nico, in terror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, hermano. Please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico starts menacingly toward the hood, breathing hard from the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who put up the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What money? Nico grabs him by the hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't come after me for a piece of ass. (twists the youth's neck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who paid you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told ya!    No one! Nico slams him with a fierce shot to the ribs. The hood doubles over, gasping. The flower girls shriek even louder. Nico turns to the girls with a ferocious glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! The girls instantly go silent in terror. Nico turns back to Machete Man, spins him violently face-down, jacking the punk's right arm straight out behind him. We see that Nico can break his elbow with one blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico raises his fist to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy Constanza! Nico shoves the hood into the ground, tearing the hood's wallet from his trouser pocket. Nico rips the wallet a- part, seizes the kid's identification and holds it up. He grabs the punk by the hair with his free hand. Machete Man is staring up in terror, wondering what this means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're lying to me, I'll come and kill you right in your own fucking kitchen. Nico dumps him on the ground and walks away.    Instantly Machete Man changes his tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salvano!   Bautista Salvano! ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                            5 Nico walks back, his foot smashes into the punk's face. He hits the ground with a thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gracias, muchacho. Nico walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico at the kitchen table spread with notepads, old add- ress books, 3X5 cards. He's on the phone, impatient, apparently getting nowhere. He slams the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico paces, phone cradled to ear, talking urgently. CLICK: he's been hung up on; he looks at the receiver in frustration and disgust.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: Nico's hands pushpin a 3X5 card into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: We read: "FBI / Agent Smith / 11:53 / B.S. / Covering for who?"

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: Nico back at the table, listening to the wiretap tape, transcribing it.

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: Nico holds Julian, goes over notes.

dialogues.speaker: G
dialogues.text: The page is headed: "FATHER GENARRO." Below in doodle formation, are a series of boxes, each one containing a phrase. We read: "Father G had some- thing on Salvano?" "Church break-in?" "Drug infor- mation?" "Father G connected to FBI?" Irritably, Nico's pencil crosses everything out.

dialogues.speaker: SARA
dialogues.text: Appears in a nightgown at the kitchen doorway.   She look frail, frightened. MUSIC ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep. Will you come and hold me? ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I will. I've been waiting to hear from Jax. She was supposed to get back to me by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico comes in with his arms around Sara. She stops near the bed, holds him tight. They look to little Julian sleeping in the crib nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God you couldn't find your shoes. We would of have been sitting in the front row. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I know the rules -- I don't ask you don't tell. But could've died today and I deserve to know. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did we go to church this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm willing to break   the rules; I'm willing to tell   you whatever I know. But I need    some time. Could you just give   me some time? Nico leans to kiss her, but is cut off by the HARSH RING of a PHONE. Sara starts at the sound. She and Nico glance at each other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet that's her. Nico picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This better be good, Jax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad, Nico. Nico glances to Sara. The voice on the   phone is not Jackson. Nico is chilled. He glances    to Sara, finger t his lips. He points to his bare wrist   as if wanting to the exact time. Sara, not sure what's   going on, mouths: "Two-fifteen."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time, Nelson. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We recognize Fox, Nico's buddy  from SE Asia whom we met in the opening sequence.  Fox,  too, of course, looks 15 years older. He wears a  suit  and seems quite prosperous We are unable to identify from  where Fox calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should know not to use a name on an open line. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna talk for fifteen seconds, then I'm getting off. You're in trouble, Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious, serious trouble. Take your wife and family and get them someplace safe now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me? Now. I'm risking my ass by telling you this. Good luck, kid.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NICO'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: The PHONE CLICKS DEAD. Nico tries to keep a casual ex- pression. Sara sees through it -- she knows he's shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Fox, wasn't it? Nico doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is the C.I.A. calling you at two in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, sweetheart -- (crosses to her, puts his arms around her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You know what a crazy bastard Fox is. He gets drunk and forgets he's halfway around the world. He calls me. Nico gives her a squeeze and a smile. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                        55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just wanted to make sure we got his Christmas card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara is sleeping next to Nico. Julian next to her. A LOUD POUNDING comes O.S. from the front door. Nico jumps out of bed. His gun appears in his hand, as if from nowhe he steps quickly to the front window, looks out --

dialogues.speaker: STREET BELOW
dialogues.text: Two unmarked cars pull in.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NICO
dialogues.text: He moves swiftly to the rear window and spots another un- marked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico enters the vestibule in his pajama bottoms with his in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F.B.I., Toscani. Open up. Nico pulls aside a curtained glass panel; he recognizes two uniformed police officers, plus Neeley and Halloran, the FBI agents who authorized the release of Salvano. He lowers his gun, opens the door. The cops surge in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to one of cops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a little early for breakfast, O'Hara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Nico. (displays warrant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaches for Nico's gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take this, thank you. Before Neeley can get his hand on the gun, Nico, without pausing, hands it over to another agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you won't. I'm gonna give it to you. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIAN BAWLS fearfully; Sara holds him, trembling. Nico is hurriedly getting dressed. A cop and the FBI agents stand at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cops; distraught)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous -- there's no need for this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, darling. Two agents enter the room carrying Nico's confiscated papers and tapes and begin rummaging through dressers, jewelry boxes and closets. Rosa crosses swiftly to calm Sara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think you are -- coming in here like this, treating my son like a criminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you terrifying us? There's an infant here! Nico pulls on a jacket. He looks like he could kill.    H restrains himself for his family's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check that coat. The cops cross to frisk Nico.   Sara, still holding the b starts slapping at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands off him! Rosa grabs Sara --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sara,                                      * allowing himself to be frisked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all a mistake, Sara -- It's                      * gonna be all right. The cops steer Nico toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Police Association's got lawyers for this, you bastards! ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                            5 Sara grabs for the phone; Nico is manhandled out the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighbors are now on their porches.   Nico is led to waiting unmarked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad Dude, the bartender we remember from Nico's first visit to the Polish bar, finishes signing a deposition. A cop takes the paper. Bad Dude stands, glances half- fearfully, half-defiantly to Nico, who is led down a hall way flanked by two uniformed officers. Agent Halloran opens the door for Bad Dude, who exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neeley, Halloran, Lieutenant Strozah and Deputy Superinte dent JACK CROWDER. Halloran indicates a stack of depositions, tapes and notes on the table before Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illegal wiretaps. Unauthorized surveillance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When were you born, asshole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Associating with known felons. Disobeying direct orders --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jackson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's outa this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the rotten apple in this barrel, Toscani. We don't have to look any farther than you and your 'family.' Nico comes out of his chair, going for Halloran.      Str tries to block him, but it's useless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico! You damn fool! You wanna go to prison?! Nico stops. He's speechless with rage.    His finger poin toward Halloran like a loaded gun. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates more depositions)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlawful entry. Illegal search and seizure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spits on papers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never build a frame on this chickenshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were ordered to back off on Salvano. But you had too big a hard-on for that, didn't you-- Nico contains his fury. He steps away from Strozah, with a gesture that says "I won't hurt you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Strozah)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred.   You can't be in on this. Nico faces his lieutenant -- a look that calls on long years of comradeship and loyalty. Strozah is torn. He's a good man, over his head in a situation he doesn't com- pletely understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're officially suspended, Toscani. I want your tin... and your iron. Neeley leans past Nico; drops Nico's gun (with an evidenc tag on it) onto the table. Nico looks to Strozah, who averts his eyes. Nico flips his badge onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You holding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can walk for now. But don't walk far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are outside of a cop breakfast hangout. Several police cars are parked in the lot. Nico is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara, I'm okay. I love you.                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you? Why aren't you                       * coming home?                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be home later. Lukich will                     * be there. Tell mama not to worry. Jackson and Lukich are waiting by Nico's car.    They see Nico emerge from the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mood of urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I found the sanctuary people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're refugees from El Salvador, Guatemala, Chile. They won't talk                  * to me, they're terrified of cops. Jackson has an armload of notes, including photocopies of news clippings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for this? One of the people killed at the church was definitely not a congregation member. She shows Nico and Lukich the Polaroids we saw her take i the morgue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan Singletary. He's an aide to Senator Harrison. Nico is electrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Harrison. Foreign relations committee. The guy who's been crawling all over the Central American drug connections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) You're gonna make a helluva D.A., Jax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (savors the com- pliment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been at the Tribune all night, wearing out their Xerox machine. Harrison's staff has been compiling some kind of white paper. He's due to release it next week. Nico's mind races.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how Fox knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Nico turns to Lukich, dead earnest. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke. I  want you to go to my house.  Call Branca... my mother has the number. Get my family ready to move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with 'em. We'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Nico?   What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a call last night. An old agency friend. He told me my family was in danger. Jax and Lukich can't put all the pieces together yet. if it's drugs-CIA-Senate, it's got to be heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a weapon? Lukich knows he doesn't. He glances up and down the street, makes sure no one's watching -- then cracks the driver's door of his car. There's a bulge in the map pocket. Nico  pulls out a Sig Saur .45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try this on. Jackson watches Luke slip Nico a clip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPENING CLOSE ON the faces of the sanctuary refugees. They are faces that have known fear and tragedy. The kind of faces we see on newsreels after villages have been burned and family members murdered. The refugees have been moved from church basement to a back room in the day care center. Nico kneels, facing them. Jackson in the background. A nun (SISTER BONIFACIA) and a priest (whom we saw in Genarro's hospital room) watch over the people. Nico is frustrated; he can't crack the refugees' fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to nun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister... you know me. Tell them there's no need for fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is rubble all over the yard, Nicola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to refugees) I was there... in the church. They tried to kill my family, too. Several of the refugees look like they want to speak, but they are terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know there was a man here, from an American senator's office. Who was he going to speak to? The refugees become increasingly anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to one woman) Was it you, senora? (to a man) Was it you? More silence.    Glances among the people.   Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest. The others shrink.   The Woman glances to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? (gently) Father Genarro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other one. Nico looks to the American priest standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The young one. From Costa Rica. Sister Bonifacia sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Tomassino. Jackson has her pad out, taking notes. Bonifacia knows too much has already been revealed; she must speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came alone... two weeks ago. He had papers. Papers to give to the senator. Nico tries to contain his excitement; not scare anyone by losing his calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the bomb... The bomb was planted to destroy the pulpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Tomassino was going to give the Mass that day. (shaken)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Genarro talked him out of it. The refugees' faces confirm this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Father Tomassino they were trying to kill. Bonifacia starts softly to cry.    Nico puts his hand on shoulder, comforting her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Tomassino?   Where is he now? The nun shakes her head.   Nico looks to the refugees. They don't know, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He run, mister. He go -- He gestures: "who knows where?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you know where he is, you've got to tell me. I want to help him. I can help him. The refugees lower their eyes. Bonifacia continues her soft weeping. Nico glances to Jackson; her look says "Enough, let's leave these poor people alone." Nico stands, touches Bonifacia one more time on the shoulder -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Jackson come out.   Nico has made a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're outa this, Jax.    Go home. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (displays her notes) You see this list? Well, I'm not done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico admires his partner's guts, but he's worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a rookie, Toscani. Now, go home. Get your family out of here. Nico agrees.    The pair starts to split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls after Jackson) Just paperwork, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: Nico drives, a jumble of emotions on his face.      Urgen fear, exhaustion. He's deep in thought --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico's car pulls up at a stop light. He looks around without really seeing. An old lady pulls a shopping cart while a crossing guard takes some kids across the street.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CAR
dialogues.text: ROARS up out of nowhere, without two men inside, SCREECH- ING to a stop head-on to Nico's door. Its doors spring open --

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: dives toward his own passenger door --

dialogues.speaker: SECOND CAR
dialogues.text: leap out, OPEN FIRE with pistols and automatic weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico's car riddled with a furious FUSILLADE.      WINDOWS BLOW OUT; the driver's door is shredded -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          64.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: crawling frantically; shoving the passenger door open as a FIRESTORM of lead and FLYING GLASS BLAZES all around him.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR MEN
dialogues.text: FIRING point blank (6 to ten feet) into Nico's car.   The men are cool, professional.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: spills from the passenger door onto the ground, scrambles like mad under his own car toward one of the attackers' c

dialogues.speaker: PEDESTRIANS AROUND INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: scream and scatter in terror.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR MEN
dialogues.text: FIRING as shells spew from the ejection ports of their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: NICO'S CAR
dialogues.text: being chewed to pieces --

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: crawling at full speed from the car's front to its back. On the ground, alongside the car, spent CARTRIDGE CASES RAIN like hailstones.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR MEN
dialogues.text: As their magazines empty. The last shells spring free, GUN BARRELS SIZZLE, blue smoke fills the air. The leader waves two men forward to check their kill. At that instant:

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: springs to his feet behind the men, the Sig Saur .45 clutched in both hands. (He has crawled under both cars to envelop his attackers.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here, you sons-a-bitches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico's rage is superhuman. The men stare in conster- nation. One of the men has a fresh magazine half into his weapon -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                        65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes like an animal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try it. Be my guest. The man lets the magazine clatter to the street. The others raise their hands. It takes all Nico's strength to keep from wasting all four of them on the spot. His gaze swings wildly around the intersection. He spots a corner grocery store. A phone inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures with gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there! Move it! -- Now!! The men are scared shitless. They put their hands in back of their heads; trot jelly-legged --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Pakistani counter clerk takes one look at the mob enter ing his store and bolts for the rear. A customer exits as Nico herds his captives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands on the counter! Three men do it; the fourth is slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tempt me, ASSHOLE -- The fourth obeys. Nico moves to the pay phone on the wall, covering the men with his .45. He grabs the re- ceiver in his free hand; tries to dial. Adrenaline makes his hand shake; the dials spin wrong -- One of the men sees Nico's dilemma. To hit 911, Nico has to take his eye momentarily off his captives. As Nico turns again to the dial -- A free-standing sales display hurtles toward him, crashing into his gun hand. One of the men has lunged into the display; now he dives atop Nico a second later. The whole human pile crashes, thundering into a glass freezer. Somehow Nico gets to his feet. One of the men grabs Nico's gun; Nico swings one of the freezer doors -- Wham! -- smack into the man's face. The GLASS SHATTERS; the man drops like a rock. Now it's three against one -- prime odds for Nico. He wades into his attackers. A coffee stand goes flying. A body sails into a makeup display. One fool is lucky enough to land a blow that bloodies Nico's nose; he pays with a shattere forearm and a head-first heave into an ice cream locker -

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE STORE
dialogues.text: It looks like a tornado has hit the interior. Magazine RACKS CRASH, mayo jars fly through the air, the ICE MACHINE seems to EXPLODE as a man's back careens into it ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                            6

dialogues.speaker: STREET CORNER UP BLOCK
dialogues.text: Two police cars heave into view, SIRENS WAILING --

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOORS OF STORE
dialogues.text: Nico takes the last man, lifts him up, and drives him lik a battering ram straight through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: Wild-eyed and bloody, sees the cop cars whipping into the corner. He spins to see his .45 on the floor -- too far away to race for. He bolts down a gangway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS next to Lukich. Sara starts towards it. Lukich stops her with a look; he picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get their stuff into the car now. Do it in the alley, not the driveway. I'll be there in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: TWO MORE POLICE CARS
dialogues.text: SQUEALING around a corner, entering the block where Nico is.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: Lets them pass, keeping low.      He sprints across the s and down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara grabs a handful of dresses from the closet and angri throws them into an open suitcase on the bed. Nico watche hoping to ride the storm. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your job and your family in one day, Nico. You're batting a thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara...                                               * Sara is at the dresser, pulling open drawers, dumping her clothes haphazardly into the suitcase. She stops suddenly She pulls out a handgun and ammo from her panty drawer. S starts to weep. Nico steps up behind her, puts his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be safe with Uncle Branca. It's gotta be this way... I'm sorry. He turns her around to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think I'd rather be with you? He holds her passionately.    Rosa coughs loudly in the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no longer angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Mama... you got your medicine? Don't forget the baby's sweater --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about babies. We glimpse other relatives in the hallway; Nico hands the a pair of suitcases; they hurry off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of Nico's bloodied shirt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you're all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am if you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to lighten up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry -- (touches him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We needed a vacation, anyway. Sara takes her suitcase, hurries out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Branca's sedan is half-loaded; Branca adds a few more bag Lukich's car is parked behind it. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          67A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing yard with Sara)                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you five minutes start.    We have to do it this way. They get their suitcases into the sedan. Mama and the bab are already aboard. Sara gets into the passenger seat. Lukich comes around from the front, glancing around like lookout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks there may be documents at some guy's apartment. Nico starts toward the rear basement door.    Lukich fall in with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Lukich enter, start down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed the wrong priest. Lukich doesn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a second priest... from Costa Rica... hiding at the church. He was the one they meant to kill. Nico starts to remove a large piece of ducting from the basement heater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know where to find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The hole in the foundation holds several shotguns and a couple of pistols, some passports and some cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna need help. Nico grabs the pistols, starts to strap them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stay with my family Nico replaces the piece of foundation, starts back up the steps. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Branca STARTS the SEDAN. Sara looks back, pained. Rosa, Lukich and Julian are also in the car. Nico grabs another hand-carried case from the basement, hurries into Lukich's car.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN DRIVEWAY
dialogues.text: Two police cars pull up to the front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lukich's car continues off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Uncle Branca's car and Lukich's car out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Branca leads Nico, Sara, Rosa, Julian and Lukich down a corridor. Two older Italian women open a door leading to basement rec room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister's cousin's place. You're safe -- not even I can find this joint. The family enters the back room.    They take in their sanctuary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Neeley hurries across the lot toward his car. He ge in, STARTS the ENGINE. As he puts the car in gear --

dialogues.speaker: BARREL OF .45 AUTOMATIC
dialogues.text: nestles behind his right ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising from rear seat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget your seat belt. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                        69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico walks casually beside Agent Neeley, holding his gun of sight in his pocket. They proceed down a corridor. Be- hind them we glimpse a security checkpoint, manned by two uniformed guards, through which they apparently have alre passed.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The two walk past floor-to-ceiling warehouse shelves, pac with labeled boxes, film cans, etc. which are visible through a heavy wire-mesh screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Toscani. You just made number four on the most wanted list. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87              69A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep walking -- (another nudge) -- I'm bucking for number one. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                        70.

dialogues.speaker: ADMINISTRATIVE WINDOW
dialogues.text: A pot-bellied, Naval-retired-type CLERK looks up from his desk as Nico and Neeley come up to the counter. We see a sign: "EVIDENCE HOLDING DEPOT -- You MUST Have Your Requi sition Number!!!" The Clerk stands, chomping a cigar, wad dles to the counter. We see his arms covered with tattoos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, lads? Neeley presents his ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a quantity of C-4 explosive brought in four days ago --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, that's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right away, pardner. They scooped that stuff outa here before we even got it tagged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?    Who took it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casual)

dialogues.speaker: C.I.A.
dialogues.text: Nico reacts, nudges Neeley once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Clerk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to see the paperwork. The Clerk has an accordion file right under the counter. He indicates a sign-in book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta sign. Neeley signs the book. The Clerk starts leafing through h files, searching for the release form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I remember that guy. Flew in special from Langley. Bomb tech. Real nice fella -- (finds the form, lifts it from file)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Here it is. Fox. Nelson Fox. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           71

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: snatches the release form.     Stares at the signature, s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neeley's car parked in the boondocks along the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from car radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Here it is, sir. Coming in from Langley now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neeley holds the radio mike, as if about to say something Nico shoves his gun against the guy's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from car radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That agent has been with the Central American desk, uh, since '84 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. That's what I wanted. Nico takes the mike, clicks it back into its cradle. freezes, unsure what Nico's going to do with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motions with gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dump your shoes. Ditch your I.D. on the floor. Nico watches the FBI man obey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you think I'm a lousy cop, huh, Neeley? Maybe I am. But I haven't got                   * my face buried up Washington's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody buys me, Toscani.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Then somebody pulled the plug on your brain, pal. You didn't come up with the second priest, did you? Or Harrison's dead aide. (as Neeley fumbles with                          * his laces)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up! (as Neeley obeys)                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the radio. The Agency's pushing buttons and bodies are dropping like flies. You assholes are missing half the case! ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         72. Despite his animosity toward Nico, Neeley is beginning to realize this cop is onto something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen.     Toscani -- Nico grabs Neeley's shoes, heaves them into the back seat He shoves the agent out the door, swings himself behind t wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico drives off, leaving the FBI man miles from nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with SCORE and V.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of an elevator and down a busy corridor march the brass, Deputy Superintendent Crowder included. Lieutenant Strozah lags slightly behind. They enter an auditorium where a large contingent of press, cameras ready, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson outside an apartment door in a Yuppie-esque condo complex. She looks both ways to be safe, then slides a credit card behind the lock. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico parks Neeley's car in a huge packed lot. A towering marquee sign reads: "COMPUTER EXPO '87." Nico starts on foot toward the convention center entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson enters, looking guilty as hell. She picks up a framed photo from a piano: the dead Senator's aide posed smiling beside a distinguished-looking man (Senator Harrison) in front of the capitol building. Jackson sets the photo down, starts rummaging through desk drawers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer is alleged to be involved in illicit drug trafficking, racketeering and kidnapping -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico, in the crush of convention-goers, pauses before a booth promoting a TV manufacturer. The latest model TV's are set up in a sales display, with visitors gawking at the pictures of the church bombing aftermath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV's)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police sources also speculate that Toscani may be connected to the suspect in the bombing of St. Elizabeth's parish church -- A police composite rendering of the woman who placed the bomb at the church is shown on the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV's)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the suspect is likely to be armed and considered to be extremely dangerous -- Nico's police ID photo appears on the news.   He blends back into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other news, Senator Ernest Harrison's presidential bid has... Nico moves swiftly through the convention center floor (which is packed for thousands of square feet with sales booths, each manned by technicians and pitchmen, all displaying the latest in high-tech data processing equipment, telecommunications, etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jax stuffs a wad of offical papers -- including appoint- ment books, notes and tapes -- into her briefcase. At the apartment door, she looks both ways, then emerges, starts away down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico in the crowd in front of the booth of a Japanese computer manufacturer. Dr. Watanabe (Nico's friend whom we remember from the baptism/picnic scene) is the chief engineer at the booth, showing off some high-tech equipment to several brainy looking executives. Watanabe glances up, spots Nico. Nico makes a subtle sign to indicate he must speak to Watanabe. Watanabe crosses at once to Nico. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So good to see you again, sir! (shakes Nico's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come back near closing... five- thirty... we'll place your order then. Nico nods, fades like a shadow into the throng.     MUSIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All customers gone, lights being turned off. Janitors sweep up, the last booth people shut down for the night.

dialogues.speaker: WATANABE
dialogues.text: emerges with Nico from behind a booth divider, leads her old friend at a brisk pace across the deserted floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Wat... you know I wouldn't call in a favor -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. Just because you kept a few 'friendly' tribesmen from cutting my heart out and serving it up as Pad Thai? With a wink, Watanabe escorts Nico into a back area off t floor. Carpeted office dividers set off a small area, packed with super sophisticated computer equipment. Watanabe "boots up" a terminal, sits down with relish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last six years I've been risking nothing but money. It's a kick to risk my ass again. Nico eyes the equipment and Watanabe, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old Spook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson has the Senator's aide's papers spread before her cataloging them with interest. The PHONE RINGS. Jackson picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson. Whoever the voice is (which we can't hear), it makes Jack forget the documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yes... yes, of course, sister, I know who you are. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- where... where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watanabe working two computers simultaneously, with the gusto of a rock keyboard player. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- No way to access Covert Ops directly. But Ornstein's at Princeton, he's got a database bigger than Langley -- (works keyboard lovingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can't crack that turkey's code, it's time to hang up my rock and roll shoes -- Nico watches Watanabe work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- ah, here! Here's a little trap door. Let's see if we can wriggle up into -- (watches the screen with anticipation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personnel files! Operative dossiers. Will that do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a start. Nico sits down beside Watanabe.

dialogues.speaker: FULL ASHTRAY
dialogues.text: Watanabe stubs out a cigarette. Empty coffee cups all around. Nico paces, reading a hard-copy printout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox has had a helluva career. (reads down page)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '69 to '76, Cambodia, Laos. Operation Phoenix. Operation Green Mountain. Operaton Northstar. This is all Vang Pao, it's all heroin --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You friend has found his metier. Nico circles the "operations" on the page, hands it to Watanabe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run personnel retrievals on all these operations. I want the names of every company man who was on them.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: A list of about thirty names -- mostly civilian, but some with military rank attached. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                      75A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Altshuler. Cosgrove. I know half these guys -- (thinking) Okay... now run me an update. Where are these fuckers now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           76

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: Pouring a fresh coffee, studying the screen with Watanabe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finger tracks down screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Central American desk. Central American desk. Central --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty names from secret drug operations... and two-thirds of 'em are in Central America. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Run these two names: Bautista Salvano and Ramon 'Chi Chi' Testamente.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those street dealers you were talking about? They're not gonna be in here. Nico gives her a look.    Watanabe starts punching keys.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: Official biographies of Salvano and Chi Chi come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, kiss my ass. (reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both former Somoza secret police. (whistles, impressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recruited by agency, 1975. Trained Fort Benning, counter insurgency... ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          76A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Fox's printout? (finds it, reads)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1976... Fort Benning. He recruited these pricks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's even later. The last of    the janitorial crew is finishing up the huge floor.    A few display lights rema on, otherwise it's dark. Nico    stands above, observing, contemplating the information   he has received.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watanabe crapped out in a chair; Nico looking weary, paci wracking his brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing left, Nico.     We've wrung these files dry. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself; thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox is here, in Chicago... or was here... (has an idea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Listen. Can this thing tap into airlines? Reservations records --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get you the ball scores, too.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: As he finishes viewing the screen, stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five agents   from Central American desk. All trained   assassins. All arrived in Chicago in   the last week -- and none of them has   left. Nico grabs his coat, gulps a last swallow of coffee --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Wat. You finally may have done some good for your country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To find a priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson's unmarked car whips into the curb. Aboard: Jackson and Lukich. Nico steps from the shadows, ducks into the back seat. The car takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did ya find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nun phoned me. She said two men had been sneaking around the church. She sounded scared -- Nico checks his .45.    Two spare clips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more. I got the papers from that senator's aide's apartment. Everything Harrison's been working on. It's all at my place.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATED SUBWAY TRAIN
dialogues.text: BOOMS PAST CAMERA, only a few feet away from a row of tenement apartment buildings. As TRAIN sound RECEDES, CAMERA MOVES IN ON one building. We hear LOUD UPBEAT ROCK AND ROLL coming from a third-floor apartment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from within car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you're inside, you'll signal us.

dialogues.speaker: TREMBLING WOMAN, (SAME STREET)
dialogues.text: It is the Middle-aged Woman who left the bomb, seen in Fa Genarro's church. A police sketch of her was seen on tele vision. She is looking up at the third-floor window, gett instructions. She turns around occasionally to see who's talking to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be scared. Your life depends on this.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: It is one of Salvano's goons we've seen before.    He is checking his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman walks slowly down the hall. She carries a small donation can. She knocks on a door. We hear FOOTSTEPS fro within the apartment. The door opens. It's Bonifacia, the nun from the church (though now in civvies). The Middle-A Woman with the donation can raises it as if asking for a contribution. Bonificia looks flustered, impatient. She really doesn't want to leave the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exusame, por favor. Tiene dinero para...

dialogues.speaker: FROM NOWHERE
dialogues.text: Three of Salvano's armed goons appear on both sides of th doorway. They push both women violently into the apartmen

dialogues.speaker: GOON
dialogues.text: He steps quickly, surely into the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: It flies open.   The goon points his gun AT the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Tomassino, the Costa Rican priest, stands at the window, he has been trying to open it. He turns. He knows he can't escape.

dialogues.speaker: SALVANO'S CAR
dialogues.text: The light in the apartment window blinks twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From two cars emerge the shapes of several men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson's car -- with Jackson, Nico and Lukich aboard -- swings around a corner into a traffic jam. The HORN BLARE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STEREO SPEAKER BLASTS MUSIC from the front room. CAMERA PANS ACROSS Bonifacia's bedroom dresser. We see mementos of her life and a photo of herself with Father Genarro wi a group of children. CAMERA CONTINUES TO PAN PAST Bonifac bed, PAST Bonifacia's body! CAMERA CONTINUES DOWN TO the floor, where lies the lady who planted the bomb. They bot appear dead.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER TOMASSINO
dialogues.text: He is in a chair, his wrists strapped to the chair arms. is sweating, fearful but clinging to his courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Father Tomassino, we see Salvano, Chi Chi and two other goons, armed with pistols. Salvano moves toward the priest, sets a small TV table down beside him. The priest glances toward it --

dialogues.speaker: TV TABLE
dialogues.text: Atop its rickety surface:   a fearsome array of syringes drug vials.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO FATHER TOMASSINO
dialogues.text: He glances up from the hypodermics -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                           80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTO FRAME moves Kurt Zagon! We see clearly the 15 years aging since SE Asia. His face is even scarier than when h performed similar atrocities in those days. Zagon prepare a syringe, tests it, shooting a clear liquid skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be in heaven in a few minutes, padre. But first I'm going to put you through hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico, Lukich and Jackson are speeding through the infamou Southside. We want to scream at them to get there already

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Salvano holds the priest's arm steady, Zagon moves in wit the needle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came here to talk to the                        * Senator's aide, didn't you?                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried.   But you killed him first.                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you about our plans?                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is from confession. I tell no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't lie to me, Father?   It's a sin. Father Tomassino says nothing, he begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost with kindness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you spoke to anyone, tell me now -- (indicates hypo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and I won't have to use this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unmarked police car pulls up, across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico, Jackson, and Lukich gaze at the building. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          80A

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: In the shadows by the corner, a hulking Latino man loiter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an eyeball if I ever saw one.                 *

dialogues.speaker: 296B BACK TO CAR
dialogues.text: Nico starts to open the car door.   Jackson moves to join

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're our backup. If we come out running, then you can shoot. Nico's eyes meet his partner's. It's plain he'll break he leg if he has to, to keep her safe by the car. Jackson accepts this reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Lukich exit the vehicle. Nico indicates an adjac building; he and Lukich start for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Tomassino is beginning to come under the influence Zagon's chemicals. In spite of this the priest's spirit t resist is astounding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak to me, Father -- who did you tell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you are. I know what beasts you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Lukich emerge from the roof door, guns drawn. Th roof is empty. Antennas, skylights, clotheslines. The pai creep soundlessly onto the next roof. They cross toward t roof door like infantrymen, moving one at a time from cov to cover, covering each other. They reach the door that leads down into the building. Nico checks the far side of the enclosure, nods to Lukich. Lukich cracks the roof doo open --

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL FROM ROOF
dialogues.text: Nico and Lukich creep down the stairs from the roof.    N opens the door leading to the top (third) floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drugs have taken hold. The priest's brain is an open memory bank for Zagon to probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know who you told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely coherent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them... you make the ninos... see... castrating their fathers -- raping... mutilating their mothers ... And... (breaks down crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and sometimes... to the ninos...

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: As he slowly pushes the door open.   The hallway is empty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Lukich pad in. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                           82 Quickly Lukich checks the stairs leading down. Nico cross silently past the first apartment door, checks the far en the hallway. Nico comes back toward the apartment door. Lukich approaches from the opposite side. They take up positions flanking the door, guns drawn. The LOUD MUSIC CONTINUES from inside.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Salvano and Chi Chi look on, revulsed. Whatever is happen to Father Tomassino is enough to make even cruel men ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Tell me the truth, Father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest's eyes roll grotesquely; he convulses, sweat beading on his forehead. He looks like a man in the agoni of some narcotic hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (close to priest) -- Can we kill him? If you told anyone, about our plans to kill the senator, we cannot do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadie.   Nadie. Nadie.                             *

dialogues.speaker: NICO AND LUKICH IN HALLWAY
dialogues.text: O.S. we hear another ELEVATED TRAIN APPROACHING outside. Nico kicks the apartment door in! He and Lukich burst in, guns clutched two-handed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first goon reacts, raises his pistol. Lukich SHOOTS h Nico NAILS the second goon, just as Chi Chi aims his sawe off pistol-grip shotgun at Nico. Nico has a split second dive behind a heavy upholstered chair. Chi Chi's DOUBLE- BARREL BLAST blows the chair into powder. Almost instan- taneously Nico sees the priest -- just as Zagon slashes t priest's throat! Salvano SHOOTS Lukich point blank, in th shoulder, sending Lukich's gun sailing. Nico, FIRING, gra Lukich, dives out the door with him --

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Zagon and Salvano OPEN FIRE from the apartment full-tilt. BULLETS RIP through the WALL, BLASTING WOOD and PLASTER everywhere. Nico shoves Lukich toward the stairwell --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!   Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Simultaneously FIRING back through the kicked-in door, EMPTYING his GUN. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                         83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish, from apartment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him! Finish him! Nico is slamming a fresh clip in, Lukich is stumbling awa toward the stairwell. Salvano and Chi Chi appear in the apartment doorway. Chi Chi levels his fierce "hogleg" at Nico's head. At that instant -- A broadside of BULLETS sl into the wall around Chi Chi. It's Jackson -- on the stai Chi Chi is hit, but spins, FIRES. His shotgun blast catch Jackson square in the chest, blowing her back like a doll down the stairwell, out of sight. Nico reacts with agony, twists on the floor, SHOOTS Chi Chi in the face. Nico pul the trigger as fast as he can, sending a HAIL of FIRE thr the doorway, through the walls. Salvano clutches his henc man, using his dead body as a shield; Nico's BULLETS blow Chi apart. Zagon FIRES back, hits Nico in the side by the ribs! Nico tries to fire back; he's empty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! Nico bolts for the stairwell to the roof, clawing for a n clip as he goes. Salvano and Zagon burst into the hallway SHOOTING at Nico.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATED TRAIN
dialogues.text: THUNDERING along the tracks adjacent to the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico highballs from the stairwell as the tarpaper roof er all around him with GUNFIRE from the floor below! He dive sideways, rolling to avoid the fire -- He recovers his footing in time to see Salvano and Zagon burst onto the r from the stairwell. Nico's BULLETS miss them; they separa taking cover behind two walls at the roof's margins. Nico is trapped -- in the open.

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON AND SALVANO
dialogues.text: pop back out, aiming at Nico --

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: leaps off the roof!

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATED TRAIN
dialogues.text: Nico lands on the roof of the speeding "el" train, his momentum nearly carrying him off the far side --

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: catches a railing, claws at it.   BULLETS rip into the tr roof all around him -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          84.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP TENEMENT ROOF
dialogues.text: FIRE for all they're worth at Nico's receding form.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP TRAIN
dialogues.text: crawls to the space between cars, lowers himself down. clings to the swaying chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico staggers through the almost empty car and collapses a bench.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND CORNER
dialogues.text: hurtle INTO VIEW under the El, SIRENS BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON TENEMENT ROOF
dialogues.text: Zagon and Salvano scramble away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cleaner, more upscale neighborhood. Nico labors down th steps, clutching his jacket to his ribs. Several affluent people look at him oddly, he ignores them, keeps going -- makes his way up the street, weakening, to a tasteful bro stone. Nico climbs the steps in pain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico over the sink, shirt off, WATER RUNNING -- applying makeshift bandage to his bloody ribs. We see Jackson's ma up stuff along the counter, feminine robes hanging on the door, law books around a reading stand. Nico is in real pain, exhausted, weakening --

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Nico at Jackson's desk, its surface spread with the notes and papers she got from Senator Harrison's aide's place. glimpse them: photos of Central American atrocities, dead bodies, etc. He tries to study them, quickly, but his attention shifts -- Nico glances around the apartment: more law books, Jackso degree on the wall, her rowing machine on the floor, seve framed photos beside him on her desk. Nico turns several toward him. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          85.

dialogues.speaker: FRAMED PHOTOS
dialogues.text: Jackson with her sisters and their kids, Jackson in law class, Jackson and Nico posing, smiling, at the police sh ing range --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NICO
dialogues.text: He starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jackson's photo) -- Had to be a hero... another fucking hero. I'm sorry Jax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for a small calendar, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: CALENDAR
dialogues.text: Nico circles "meet with Father Tomassino." Nico circles another date, "Senator delivers foreign policy position paper/Committee for Democratic Policy fund raiser."

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NICO
dialogues.text: Nico scoops up the aide's papers, stands, wobbly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Senator... -- (of papers, with scorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- dumb fuck... think they're gonna let you put 'em outta business --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several cops frantically clear the way to the emergency r A gurney is wheeled down the corridor. Lukich, a shoulder bandaged, walks beside the gurney, holding the hand of Ja

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a bloody flak jacket rests upon the gurney.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: She's been sedated. She has buckshot wounds on her neck a shoulder, but she is alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lukich) You call Nico's goddamn Uncle and find out if he's heard anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        85A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wounded himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just shutup and take it easy, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of Nico riding through the wet streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lukich is on the phone. His shirt is off and he's being bandaged. In the background Jackson is also being cared for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know what happened to him, Branca. Ya, she's gonna be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Branca, a bodyguard next to him, grimly puts down the pho He looks devastated. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the darkness, Nico appears, barely making it up the driveway. We hear the sound of the CAB DRIVE OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Branca and a bodyguard come forward, grabbing Nico as Nic almost collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motherfuckas got Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lukich called. She's not dead. She's gonna make it. She was wearing a vest. Nico can't believe it. In spite of it all, life comes to him. A little smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That broad didn't trust me.

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: We glimpse several armed bodyguards in concealed position A late-model Cadillac pulls up. A man carrying a doctor's bag gets out and is escorted to the side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosa has pulled back the curtain from the second-floor be room window. She witnesses the arrival of the doctor. On the bed behind her sleep Sara and Julian. A bodyguard stands outside the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor tends Nico. Bloody bandages and antiseptic bottles litter a coffee table. Two guards stand by. Branc is showing Nico an 8-by-11 photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was picked up with your mail this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: A shot of Nico's family taken from a parked car, in front the church, the morning of the bombing. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          87.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NICO AND BRANCA
dialogues.text: Nico's grim expression shows he knows just what this mean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, they're booked on an early plane. They'll be out of the country tomorrow. Nico winces as the doctor finishes applying a bandage. the background we hear a COMMOTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bodyguard tries to fend off the physical and verbal ass from Sara and Rosa. Sara carries Julian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sara rushes to Nico's side.    Nico reaches for her, but the pain stabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Nico!                                       * Rosa starts forward, her face in agony at the sight of he wounded son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine.   The boy has ribs of steel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching Nico's brow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of your humor. Sara clings to Nico's arm, tears in her eyes. Rosa crosses herself. Sara begins to weep. The doctor finishes There's a long awkward moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to doctor and bodyguards)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave them. Leave them alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosa sits in a chair. Nico on the couch, holding Julian. Sara faces him. Tears have stained her cheeks, but she is in control of her emotions now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You've got to do it, Nico.    You know you have to. Whatever Sara is proposing, Nico is dead set against it. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to her, Nicola. (dead serious) Whatever you think of him, Federico is family. He is our family. Nico makes no response.   Instead, he lifts Julian, nuzzl him tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever notice how clean babies smell? Like nothing in the world has touched them yet. Sara glances to Rosa. Rosa knows what she wants. Dis- creetly Rosa rises, exits. Sara and Nico are alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you won't go to him, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) Don't push me like this -- Her eyes meet his -- loving, but desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Branca can put us on a plane -- but where can we fly to? Tibet? The moon? There's nowhere they can't find us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what the hell you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about everything I've learned from you in the past five years. Nico is in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't go to him. Sara takes both his hands in hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why I love you? Do you know what it is about you that I've always loved? (as Nico fights his own emotion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pride. It's what you have inside. You don't live the way other people live. You trust what you see as right and won't let anyone or anything make you stray from it. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           88 MOVE IN PAST Sara TO Nico's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now that pride may kill all of us. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to swallow that pride, Nico. Choke on it if you have to. Lay it aside.

dialogues.speaker: NICO AND SARA
dialogues.text: Close together, with their baby between them. Sara buries her face against her husband's chest. Nico's arm goes around her. He holds her tight.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: He wears a suit and tie, a hat.   All business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
