dialogues.text: Is this the attorney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come now, Mr. Carlucci. O.S. we hear a METALLIC sound BEGIN, VERY CLOSE -- PULL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To reveal bars which slide electrically to the side.    A prison door opens, letting him through.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Nico, escorted by a prison guard, walks down a long, blan hallway.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: Waiting in a barren reception room.   Several benches, ta heavy steel mesh over windows --

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS ROOM
dialogues.text: A steel door opens on the far side. Out steps a small Italian man in his seventies, wearing the faded denim of an inmate. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                         88B-

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Nico and the small man (FREDERICO LARUSSO) walk together a long corridor, speaking occasionally, the tension thick between them. Behind them, a discreet fifteen paces, walk two armed prison officials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man never looks directly at Nico, yet we sense ke that he is taking the younger man's measure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am only an old man. An old man with a cancer. The two are like an old and a young lion, appraising each other -- using all five senses and more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have much time, Uncle.    So I must speak plainly. Larusso listens.   Nico waits for a beat.   Then: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this is very painful for him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- For as long as I've been old enough to think, I've hated you and hated everything you stood for. Larusso takes this in without a flicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so sure that you and I were on opposite sides of the fence... and that you and your people were destroying this country -- Nico pauses, glances away across the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The most painful realization of my life was that the people I worked for and you are not far apart. (meets Larusso's eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And there's not much difference between what you are and what I was. Larusso studies Nico a long moment.    Then takes Nico's

dialogues.speaker: NICO AND LARUSSO
dialogues.text: continue across the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be    candid with you. I knew, probably    before you did, that you would be    coming to me. I knew what you would    ask... and I had every intention    of refusing you. He glances to Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is a form of wisdom to know when to cease relying only upon yourself. He keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, of course, that this Senator Harrison will never live to make his speech tomorrow. (as Nico acknowledges)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, too, that as long as this man... this torturer -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurt Zagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- As long as this Zagon lives, nothing I can do will guarantee your family's safety. (beat) 'Ecce non uomine, ecce bestie.' You know Dante? (translates) 'These are not men, these are animals.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larusso stops, takes a small note pad from his pocket. quickly scribbles a few lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Memorize this address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the paper for Nico to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got it in your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico nods.    Larusso tears the paper into tiny shreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man takes his leave of Nico with a warm, if forma handshake. The guards stand by, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Carlucci. I trust you will give my love to my niece, Rosa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will do that, Mr. Larusso. (sincerely) I hope you will be well.

dialogues.speaker: LARUSSO
dialogues.text: nods: "Bene." Then: without a word he turns and exits back through the steel door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers file aboard a flight to Toronto. Hugs, goodbye Rosa, carrying the baby, is among the crowd moving toward the boarding door. Leaving with them are two of Branca's men. We PICK OUT Branca and two of his bodyguards near th fringes, looking inobtrusive but definitely on guard. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           92

dialogues.speaker: CORNER NEAR BRANCA
dialogues.text: Hidden by a bank of phones, Sara clings to Nico, holding him as tight as she can. When she releases him, we can't hear what she says, but it seems like, "Be careful, pleas careful." Nico glances to Branca, who motions subtly to hurry. He squeezes Sara's hand, she joins the crowd swelling toward the boarding door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Air Canada PLANE BLASTS skyward.

dialogues.speaker: NICO AND BRANCA
dialogues.text: watch from an open corner of a parking lot. As the plane begins its bank to gain altitude, Branca turns to Nico. The two bodybuards keep a discreet watch nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the architect's drawings? Wiring, floor plans -- Nico indicates a briefcase he is carrying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all here. Nico turns to his uncle.    Regards him with affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could help you from here on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your business. Nico embraces his uncle by both shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grazie, tio caro. Branca pats Nico's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself, Nicola.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: SEVERAL SHOTS of high-rise cityscapes at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        94.

dialogues.text: thru 360

dialogues.speaker: CHICAGO SKYLINE
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS TO the apartment complex across the plaza. FOCUS ON one suite on the topmost floor. Curtains are dra on all windows, but through one crack we glimpse a man pacing. The man wears a white shirt and a shoulder holste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TO the roof of the apartment complex. We see a heli-pad. Two more men, also in suits -- smoking, talking. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK TO the apartment suite. Now another man crosses befo the gap in the curtains. Wearing a cowboy hat: Zagon! He's laughing, pouring himself a drink at the wet bar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico, looking through a high-tech night telescope. His briefcase is by his feet, open. Several architect's drawings, floor plans visible.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: lifts his eye from the scope, jots a note on a pocket pad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even you can hit him at this range, Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O.S. behind Nico: the unmistakable sound of a .45 SAFETY being CLICKED OFF. Nico freezes, his back to the voice. H raises his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't the plan, Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON FOX
dialogues.text: covers Nico from behind with a silencer-fitted .45. He glances to the briefcase and building plans, on the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close range, huh? Never work. Place is rigged, scanned every 35 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back still turned) I was thinking of a mine on the roof. Remote-triggered, when the chopper comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roof's wired too.   Sensors every fifteen feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox's finger rests ready on the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can turn now.   Slowly.   Slooowly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico turns. We see Fox clearly now. His boyish features have weathered since his "spook" days in Vietnam. There i grey in his hair now: he wears an expensive suit and is alone. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                         96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured you'd do your recon from this building. Nico regards his old mate across the gun barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking fit, Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting a bit of a tire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicates Fox's suit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your own tailor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hong Kong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gone a long way. Fox motions for Nico to dump his gun; Nico complies, drop it gently into the briefcase. Nico takes half a step towa Fox. Fox shakes his head in warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh uh.  Uhhh-uh... (motions Nico back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you can do when you get too close to a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you, Fox.                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico walks, hands behind his head. Fox is catty-corner be hind him, carrying the briefcase, .45 leveled at Nico's b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What's so hard to believe. I want to help you, you dumb guinea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox the fixer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I wanted to cap you, I'd have saved myself this chit-chat. Make big points for me to bring in your scalp. I'd be White House material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what Zagon is?    One of your basement boys? ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                96A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zagon's a rancher. 4000 acres in Costa Rica. Beautiful place. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                         97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bought with what -- opium from Cambodia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a ton a week of coke from other places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which he funnels here through Salvano. With the Company getting its cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legal tender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still dodging appropriations committees, eh, Nelson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my job, Nico. They arrive at an elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your nose in the corner. When we get out, stay five paces ahead of me. Cross down to the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico and Fox emerge from the elevator. Nico lowers his ha from behind his head. Fox keeps his gun out of sight as h and Nico step past.

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR BANK
dialogues.text: Fox maintains a slight distance behind Nico as they cross ward some escalators under a sign: "TO PARKING LEVEL 8."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Senator couldn't be bought, could he? He was gonna blow the lid off, so you cleared Zagon to frost him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a corner and turn.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: But the priest found out somehow and ran here. You couldn't do the Senator's number 'till you knew if the priest had talked. So Zagon flew in with his little medical bag. Only by then I was in on it -- and you thought I might recognize his handiwork. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        98.

dialogues.speaker: PARKING GARAGE
dialogues.text: Several guests and diners wait by the cashier's booth for their cars to be fetched. Valets hustle with tickets. Fox and Nico come off the escalator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your name was Joe Smith I never would have caught it. But how many Nicola Toscani's are there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it off the arrest sheet. Fox hands his ticket to the cashier, motions Nico to the side, away from the guests, still keeping his distance -- should Nico try to make a move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to warn you, old buddy. I knew you had wiretaps. and I knew you wouldn't let 'em go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only I was too dumb to crack it. I was so busy trying to figure a code, I didn't even recognize Zagon's voice. It's all crystal clear to Nico now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we kill our own senators now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?   The Romans did. A Cadillac pulls up; the valet hops out, two particularly florid, well-fed guests get in, tipping the valet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fox, watching the guests)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we the Romans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're an empire too. Fox doesn't like the look Nico gives him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather spoon borscht and quote Lenin? (losing patience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to save you, asshole! I got a spot for you. Thailand, deep under, no names, no numbers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing what -- processing heroin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You 'consult.' You 'assist.' You send checks to your family. Zagon won't touch you, you'll be on the team --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In five years you're out, with a fat Swiss account and a GS-15 pension. Nico stares at his old friend with contempt. He sees the gun under Fox's coat, but he's too tired and too disguste to care --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Fox, right now in Israel they're trying some 80-year-old camp guard for war crimes. And all around our country there are guys on Death Row for killing one person, two people. And probably they all deserve it -- He takes a step toward Fox.   Fox's hand tightens on his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotion rising) -- but you and I know a couple guys personally who are responsible for the murder of at least what... 60,000 non- military personnel. (ticks off the beats) Viet. Lao. Thai. Cambodian. Librarians, teachers, doctors... women, children... and that's just a sliver of it. Fox tries to maintain a hard face.   But his own guilty conscience is working --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (presses closer) We've wiped out entire fucking countries. And not one agent --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moves gun into Nico's view) Stop right there! ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                           10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't stop) -- not one C.I.A. agent has ever been tried or convicted, much less accused of any crimes. (closer still) You motherfuckers think you're above the law -- (right in Fox's face) Well, you ain't above mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico holds himself, trembling with intensity. At that moment -- O.S. from the garage entrance ramp: the SQUEAL of APPROACHING TIRES. Nico and Fox turn to see --

dialogues.speaker: A BIG CAR
dialogues.text: SCREECHES to a halt in front of them. Five men dismount swiftly. Salvano, Bad Dude, and two agent types from the tenement... and Zagon! Zagon and his men are forty feet from Nico and Fox, playi it cool so as not to alarm any innocent bystanders, but t bulk under their jackets is unmistakably guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... well.    What a team we have here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls, friendly) We've been looking for you, Nelson.    I see you've found our friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox looks shaky, unnerved: Nico's words have hit too clos to home. Now Nico backs away a step, ready for anything. One of Zagon's agents holds their car's rear door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the help, Fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't bring him, Nico.    I swear it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you two been sharing fond memories? Reminiscing about the good old days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zagon waves Nico and Fox toward his car. Zagon and Salvano start forward. Fox glances, torn, to Nico, who has backed away another half-step. Will Nico attack? Run for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay still! (to Nico) Don't fucking move!! Fox pulls his .45 from concealment, covering Nico. An EVENING-GOWNED WOMAN, waiting with her husband for their car, hears Fox's shout, sees his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs her husband's arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack -- The husband sees. So do the other guests. Salvano sees their alarm; he swings his jacket open, revealing a snub machine gun. Someone SCREAMS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring in our friend, Nelson. Salvano's muzzle covers Fox and Nico --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a good boy --

dialogues.speaker: FOX
dialogues.text: His moment of truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dive, Nico!! He FIRES -- at Salvano! In the same instant, Salvano pull his own trigger! Salvano's MACHINE GUN BURST cuts Fox dow a milli-second before Fox's .45 SLUG BLOWS Salvano off hi feet! Pandemonium. Fox, dying, slings his .45 to Nico, wh snatches it from the ground just as a HAIL of MACHINE GUN FIRE THUNDERS around him. Nico dives headlong behind a concrete column, which is instantly chewed to shreds by GUNFIRE. Zagon FIRES his MAC-10 on full automatic. A second agent hurries forward to outflank Nico. Nico pops from behind the column, DRILLS the agent broadside behind the ear, blowing the whole side of his head off! Guests a valets are shrieking in terror, hitting the deck in clusters, clawing and scrambling over each other for safe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to first agent, advancing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move! Nico springs from cover, FIRING, trying to bolt down the garage ramp, toward the lower levels. His path puts the first agent directly in Zagon's line of fire. Zagon doesn hesitate; he OPENS UP on Nico, cutting down his own man - Salvano has gotten to his feet, wounded, but still handli his gun. He  joins Zagon, rushing forward --

dialogues.speaker: RAMP TO LOWER LEVELS
dialogues.text: A valet rounds a corner, unsuspecting, bringing up a car. Nico is on him like a cat, tearing the poor boy from behi the wheel, leaping in -- ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          102

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON AND SALVANO
dialogues.text: tear around the corner at the top of the ramp.    Both OP FIRE as --

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: highballs straight toward them!

dialogues.speaker: SALVANO
dialogues.text: hold the trigger down, FULL AUTOMATIC --

dialogues.speaker: NICO'S CAR, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Nico drops below the dash, driving blind. The WINDSHIELD BLOWN APART, both FRONT TIRES EXPLODE, the RADIATOR BLAST

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON
dialogues.text: Reloading as Salvano FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: NICO'S CAR
dialogues.text: pinwheels out of control, its nose facing away from Salva and Zagon. The car BRAKES FURIOUSLY --

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: hits reverse, looking back over the seat --

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH REAR CAR WINDOW
dialogues.text: He sees Salvano, his clip empty now, hurrying to wrestle fresh magazine in --

dialogues.speaker: NICO'S CAR AND SALVANO
dialogues.text: Nico floors it in reverse, slamming into Salvano, lifting him off his feet, smashing him with the car into a metal grate wall.

dialogues.speaker: SALVANO
dialogues.text: A horrible death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the eighth floor the metal grate of the parking stru ture blows out onto the street below, followed by Salvano body.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: BURNING RUBBER FURIOUSLY, away from the wall --

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON
dialogues.text: Reloaded, turning his gun toward Nico, when --

dialogues.speaker: TWO UNIFORMED HOTEL SECURITY GUARDS
dialogues.text: hurtle around the corner from the escalators, guns drawn. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                          103

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts to Zagon) You there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zagon spins, rips both guards with a FIERCE BURST!    The Guards drop. Zagon turns to --

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: on his feet, charging straight at Zagon. Nico grabs him, slams Zagon with incredible force into a concrete column. Zagon's gun goes flying, but miraculously he spins away. Nico dives for him, gets his neck in a grip that is certa to snap it in half a second. But --

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON'S KNIFE
dialogues.text: appears in the torturer's hand.    It slashes Nico, right cross his already wounded ribs!    Nico cries in agony --

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON
dialogues.text: scampers free. Nico gets to his feet, bleeding. Nico is between Zagon and Zagon's machine gun on the ground. Zago bolts for his car. Nico dives for the gun --

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: Zagon floors it into a SCORCHING 360, BLASTS up the exit ramp, out of Nico's line of fire --

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: leaps   into the other, half-destroyed car. Its two front tires   are flat, windshield blown out, RADIATOR POURING Nico   does the only thing he can do: puts the pedal to t metal   in reverse, BLASTS across the ramp divider, takes after   Zagon in reverse --

dialogues.speaker: ON RAMP
dialogues.text: Another car is coming down.    Zagon sideswipes it into a keeps going --

dialogues.speaker: ON RAMP
dialogues.text: Rear TIRES CHURNING smoke, FRONT FLATS SCRAPING on their rims... he pours on the speed --

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF RAMP
dialogues.text: Zagon's car whips out into the night-time commotion. Pedestrians, POLICE SIRENS O.S. Zagon looks behind him --

dialogues.speaker: NICO'S CAR
dialogues.text: hurtles into view in reverse! ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                            1

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON'S CAR
dialogues.text: is trapped   by the traffic. Zagon looks around wildly, t floors the   accelerator. Zagon's car bucks straight up t pedestrian   steps, onto the plaza! Strollers scream and scatter as   it fishtails wildly, careening toward the huge stone   fountain --

dialogues.speaker: NICO'S WRECKED CAR
dialogues.text: Follows, pouring smoke, in reverse! Nico cuts Zagon off, CRASHES into Zagon's car broadside, sending it skittering sideways into the fountain retaining wall --

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON
dialogues.text: leaps free, sprints toward the hotel alley.     Nico take after him on foot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zagon races down the darkest of alleys, rounds a corner -

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: hurtles after him, gaining.     Nico whips around the all corner, straight into:

dialogues.speaker: FOUR ARMED AGENTS
dialogues.text: waiting beside a plain grey TV remote van. Nico skitters to a stop as a shotgun, an M-16 and two pistols cover him Shotgun Agent raises his weapon to fire --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   I want him! I want him alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner reads:     WELCOME COMMITTEE FOR DEMOCRATIC POLI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up. Nico, his wrists tied, is dragged into th basement of the hotel. Zagon follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweating, windowless concrete. Overhead pipes. Churning machinery. As the CAMERA REVEALS this airtight dungeon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- this is bullshit, Zagon. We got work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: in a metal chair, wrists taped in front of him. One agent stands behind him, clasping a thin cable noose wrapped tight around Nico's throat. Shotgun agent holds his weapon on him, its twin muzzles inches from Nico's skull.

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON
dialogues.text: finishes washing his hands in an industrial-type sink. He is cleaned up, wearing a fresh shirt, his hair combed. When he dries his hands, he looks like a surgeon preparin to operate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got an hour before the honorable senator. (hands towel to pistol agent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to learn to take time, smell the roses. Zagon turns to Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you gonna do him, Zagon? In a motorcade? Or passing through a hotel kitchen? The Noose agent jerks his cable tight, making Nico gag an choke. Zagon motions to slacken off. He stops at a small table before Nico -- unrolls a well-worn felt pouch Zagon watches Nico's reaction as the tools of the inter- rogator's trade come into view -- drug vials, syringes, scalpels, surgical tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've used these little beauties many times to extract information -- (lifts a needle to the light)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- This'll be the first time I've ever used them... just for fun. Zagon sets the syringe down, slips on a heavy, weighted glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to agents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take his arms. Pistol agent and Bad Dude move in, one on each side, seizing Nico's forearms. Shotgun agent holds his weapon tight to Nico's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zagon punches Nico square in the face, so hard the chair reels backward, spinning out from under Nico --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold him up! Pistol agent and Bad Dude lift Nico. Zagon slams him again. Again. Nico's cheekbone is broken; blood drains from his nose. Zagon aims a two-handed blow; backhands Nico, crushing the other side of his face! Zagon backs off, chest heaving. Pistol agent and Bad Dude plop Nico back in the chair, gagging, choked by the noose. Nico looks like the Viet prisoner -- the one we saw in the opening sequence. Like the prisoner, Nico takes his beating -- still conscious, still meeting Zagon's eyes with defiance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where you came in, Toscani. Only, now it's where you're gonna check out. He takes off his glove, grabs the syringe. Pistol agent and Bad Dude clamp Nico's right arm down tight. Zagon injects Nico.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: reacts instantly to the hypo -- cursing, sputtering under the choking noose. He twists wildly trying to free him- self, but the agents' powerful arms hold him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. Fight it, cherry. Fight it, so it speeds faster on its way -- Nico struggles more violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fight it. Till the vessels burst in your brain. Till the arteries rupture in your heart -- Slowly, the struggle goes out of Nico. His muscles go limp; he slumps -- drooling, babbling incoherently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my boy. That's what I was waiting for -- Zagon produces his famous knife. He motions Pistol agent and Bad Dude to release Nico's arms. Noose agent slackens his grip on the choke cable. Zagon moves in closer, gloating, cooing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fool learns from his own mistakes. But a wise man learns from the mistakes of others -- (moves closer, blade in hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have killed me when you had the chance, Toscani -- The blade moves to Nico's throat. Suddenly: Nico springs to life (catching Noose man by surprise and jerking the cable from his grip) -- grabbing Zagon with his taped hands by the throat, lifting him bodily, slamming him ferociously into the wall! Zagon drops to the floor, half-conscious. Nico spins instantly to find: the Shot- gun agent right behind him, raising his weapon to Nico's face, about to pull the trigger. Nico sidesteps, grabbing the man's wrist. The SHOTGUN GOES OFF, missing Nico by inches, blasting a huge chunk out of the concrete wall. The Noose agent draws his weapon from his shoulder holster. Nico snaps the Shotgun agent's wrist, flipping him through the air, simultaneously grabbing the weapon, spinning behind the Noose agent, then using the shotgun barrel like a club to smash the back of his head in! Another swing wipes out Pistol agent. Bad Dude, now with a clear shot, aims his M-16. Nico blows him away with a double-barreled SHOTGUN BLAST. In a flash, Nico has spun to Zagon's surgical tool table, lifted a rzor-sharp scalpel and slashed the tape, freeing his hands. He yanks the choke cable off his neck --

dialogues.speaker: ZAGON
dialogues.text: On his feet again. He reaches swiftly to the floor, snatches up his famous knife. Nico confronts him -- face battered, bloody -- shaking, battling internal spasms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you feel the chemicals, cherry? You can't fight 'em much longer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long enough to finish you. Sweating, half-spitting, Zagon slashes at Nico like an animal -- Nico traps the knife, and enters, smashes Zagon in the face with one lightning blow. We see Zagon's nose and face completely cave in. Nico comes under Zagon's elbow, the arm that still holds the knife clamping it in a vise-like grip and bending it backwards, slowly, agains the joint -- which now starts to rip in half. Zagon is screaming and cursing, writhing in agony -- The drugs have hit Nico full force now. He's weakening, his eyes are starting to roll. Zagon tries one last surge of strength to save himself; it almost seems he'll wriggle free when: the elbow JOINT SNAPS in half with a sicken- ing sound. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87 As the joint hangs, dangling grotesquely, Nico reaches up around Zagon's neck, still holding the dangling limb with one arm. He begins to now do to Zagon's neck what he did to his arm. We hear a terminal CRACK. Zagon's body crumples to the floor. Nico, in delirium, staggers toward the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman at a pay phone.    She turns, drops the receiver in shock as --

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: bursts, delirious, from the stairwell door!

dialogues.speaker: MAIN LOBBY
dialogues.text: A commotion as Lukich, Agent Neeley and Jackson, arm in a sling, race in from their car.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN LOBBY
dialogues.text: weaves wildly forward. He drops to his knees.     Guests react in astonishment and horror.

dialogues.speaker: 412A JACKSON
dialogues.text: is the first to spot Nico.    She runs up to him as he collapses.

dialogues.speaker: 412B NICO
dialogues.text: looks at Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: LUKICH AND NEELEY
dialogues.text: reach Nico and Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting for anyone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a hotel doctor?    Call 911! ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                          108

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: passes out in Jackson's arms. Behind them we see a banner announcing Senator Harrison's address. From the ballroom hear CHEERS and APPLAUSE. A fiery address is being finish inside. The senator is now leaving.

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY
dialogues.text: Total confusion. Guests staring everywhere. From a side office, a man with a medical bag comes running. The senat sees the group around Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press vans outside; a crush of cars, reporters, neighbors Newsmen are trying to gain access to the house, held back by several cops and some of Nico's more strapping relatives. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87

dialogues.speaker: BUICK STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: escorted by two police motorcycles, pulls in. The press surrounds it as Lukich, Neeley, Lieutenant Strozah and Jackson, her arm in a sling, disembark from the car.

dialogues.speaker: 417A SECOND CAR
dialogues.text: pulls up. Neeley walks over and opens the door as a court stenographer, carrying her transcription machine case, st out -- followed by a federal judge, CLAYTON ALSPAUGH and SENATOR ERNEST HARRISON.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTERS
dialogues.text: shove mikes and cameras at the senator and the judge, sho questions. Lukich, Neeley and Strozah clear a path for th

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Harrison and Alspaugh fend off the questions, cross the p and mount the steps to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in front of house) -- Senator Harrison has today issued a statement calling for the appointment of a special prosecutor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico, propped up on the couch, looking like hell, but de- finitely conscious and in full command of his faculties. Sara, Jackson, and Rosa beside him.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: A network ANCHOR delivers the headline news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earlier this week, the Harrison Commission delivered its report on the growing C.I.A. scandal to Congress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image changes to SENATOR HARRISON behind a battery of microphones, sitting at a senate hearing-type table, with plaque reading "SEN. ERNEST HARRISON" before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on TV) -- officially-sanctioned deceit, murder and corruption, will continue until these men are brought to justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/17/87                        109A.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: looks up as the real Senator Harrison, Judge Alspaugh and the others enter the room. TV SOUND DOWN. Harrison stops before Nico, taking a moment to look with respect and ad- miration at the man propped up on the pillows. ABOVE THE LAW - Rev. 4/29/87                            1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Toscani. I wanted to personally thank you. You are making it possible for a sliver of truth to finally come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out his hand.    Nico takes it.   The senator ge to Judge Alspauch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is Clayton Alspaugh of the fifth circuit court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge nods to his stenographer, who swiftly sets up her equipment, takes a seat. Rosa makes a face at Branca, who rises, clearing a seat for the Judge. Sara moves in tight beside Nico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're feeling well enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nico glances to Sara, to the supporting faces around him. Lukich. Neeley. Strozah. Jackson. The others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alspaugh) If you're ready to listen, I'm ready to talk.

dialogues.speaker: STENOGRAPHER'S HANDS
dialogues.text: As the Judge's VOICE begins OVER, "slating" the depo- sitions, the stenographer's fingers start moving.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE ROOM
dialogues.text: The full scene. Nico telling his story.      Responsible officials recording it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
